English: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Abenaki: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Bulgarian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Chinese: 你游荡到了黑暗林山。 在没有准备好的情况下这里是非常危险的。 你必须击败赤血灵鹿才能获得探索这里的资格。
Croatian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Czech: Zatoulal ses do Černého lesa. Toto místo může být pro nepřipravené velmi nebezpečné. Dokažte svou zásluhu tím, že zabiješ Eikthyra.
Danish: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Dutch: Je bent het zwarte bos ingegaan. Deze plek kan erg gevaarlijk zijn voor wie niet voldoende is voorbereid. Bewijs dat je waardig bent door Eikthyr te verslaan.
Estonian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Finnish: Olet vaeltanut Mustametsään. Tämä paikka voi osoittautua vaaralliseksi niille, jotka eivät ole varautuneet sen uhkiin. Osoita kykysi tappamalla Eikthyr.
French: Vous avez atteint la Forêt noire. Cet endroit peut être très dangereux pour ceux qui ne sont pas assez préparés. Prouvez votre valeur en éliminant Eikthyr.
Georgian: თქვენ იხეტიალეთ შავ ტყეში. ეს ადგილი ძალიან საშიში შეიძლება იყოს მათთვის ვინც მოუმზადებელი შევა იქ. დაამტკიცეთ რომ ღირსეული ხართ ეიქთირის შემუსვრით.
German: Du hast dich in den dunklen Wald begeben. Dieser Ort kann für alle, die nicht vorbereitet sind, äußerst tödlich sein. Stelle deine Wert unter Beweis, indem du Eikthyr tötest.
Greek: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Hindi: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Hungarian: Betévedtél a Fekete erdőbe. Ez a hely nagyon veszélyes lehet a felkészületlenek számára. Bizonyítsd a rátermettségedet az Eikthyr megölésével!
Icelandic: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Italian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Japanese: 黒い森に迷い込んだな。 ここは不用意に足を踏み入れると、非常に危険な目に遭うことがある。 エイクスュルを倒し、自分の力を証明せよ。
Korean: 검은 숲에 걸어들어 왔군. 이곳은 준비되지 않은 자에게 매우 위험할 수 있어. 에이크쉬르를 무찌르고 실력을 증명해 보이는 것이 어떤가.
Lithuanian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Macedonian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Norwegian: Du har vandret inn i Svartskogen. Dette området kan være farlig for de uforberedte. Vis din styrke ved å slakte Eikthyr først.
Polish: Trafiasz do Czarnego lasu. To niezwykle niebezpieczny teren dla niedoświadczonych podróżników. Pokaż, na co cię stać, zabijając Eikthyra.
Portuguese: Vagueaste até à Floresta negra. Este lugar pode ser muito perigoso para aqueles que não estão preparados. Prova o que vales matando Eikthyr.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você entrou na Floresta Negra, um lugar muito perigoso para quem não está preparado. Antes de mais nada, mate Eikthyr para provar o seu valor.
Romanian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Russian: Вы забрели в Черный лес. Это место может быть очень опасным для неподготовленных. Докажите, что вы достойны, убив Эйктюра.
Serbian: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Slovak: You have wandered into Black forest. This place can be very dangerous for those unprepared for it. Prove your worth by slaying Eikthyr.
Spanish: Te has adentrado en el Bosque negro. Este lugar puede ser muy peligroso para quienes no estén preparados... Así que acaba con Eikthyr para demostrar que tienes la fuerza suficiente para acceder.
Swedish: Du har strövat in i den Svarta Skogen. Denna plats har skördat många oförberedda krigares liv. Visa dig värdig genom att först besegra Eiktyr.
Thai: เจ้าหลงเข้าไปในป่าดำ ป่านี้มันอันตรายมากถ้าเจ้ายังไม่พร้อม พิสูจน์ความพร้อมด้วยการกลับไปสังหารอิ๊กเทียร์ให้ได้ซะ
Turkish: Kara Orman'a adım attın. Kara Orman, hazırlık yapmayanlar için çok tehlikeli bir yer olabilir. Eikthyr'i öldürerek hazır olduğunu kanıtla.
Ukrainian: Ось і в чорноліссі ти, але для непідготовлених це місце таїть смертельні небезпеки. Доведи свою готовність, убивши Ейктюра.

Thai: ฮูกิ้น: วอร์ด
คุณสร้างวอร์ดแล้ว

English: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Abenaki: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Bulgarian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Chinese: 这块带着强大光环的守护石能阻止其他维京战士在区域内建造或拆除。 它也能锁上区域内所有的门。
Croatian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Czech: Srážce vydává kouzelné těsnění na blízké okolí, které brání ostatním hráčům ve stavbě budov nebo otevírání dveří.
Danish: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Dutch: Deze verzegeling heeft een sterke aura, wat voorkomt dat andere Vikingen hier dingen kunnen bouwen. Het doet ook alle deuren onder zijn invloed op slot.
Estonian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Finnish: Suojeluskivella on voimakas aura, joka estää muita viikinkejä rakentamasta mitään. Se myös lukitsee kaikki ovet vaikutusalueellaan.
French: La balise émet une aura puissante empêchant les autres Vikings de construire dans cette zone. Elle verrouille également les portes dans sa zone d'effet.
Georgian: დამცავი აფრქვევს ძლიერ აურას, რომელიც ხელს უშლის სხვა ვიკინგებს ააშენონ რამე ახლო მახლოში. ის ასევე კეტავს ყველა კარს სხვებისთვის.
German: Der Wächterstein verströmt eine mächtige Aura, die andere Wikinger am Errichten von Gebäuden hindert. Außerdem verschließt er alle Türen in seinem Einflussbereich.
Greek: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Hindi: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Hungarian: Ez a védőkő erős aurát bocsát ki, és megakadályozza a többi vikinget az építkezésben, emellett bezárja az összes ajtót is a hatókörében.
Icelandic: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Italian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Japanese: 守護石は強いオーラを放ち、他のバイキングが建物に近づくことを防ぐ。 また、その影響下にあるすべてのドアに鍵をかける。
Korean: 경비석은 다른 바이킹들이 건물을 짓는 것을 방해하는 강한 기운을 내뿜지. 또한 영향력 아래에 있는 모든 문들을 잠가버린다네.
Lithuanian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Macedonian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Norwegian: Denne Vergestatuen utgir en sterk aura som forhindrer andre vikinger fra å bygge ting i nærheten. Den låser også alle dører innenfor sin radius.
Polish: Kamień strażniczy emituje silną aurę, która uniemożliwia innym wikingom budowanie w jej zasięgu. Zamyka również wszystkie drzwi w swoim zasięgu.
Portuguese: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Portuguese_Brazilian: A proteção emite uma aura forte que impede outros vikings de construírem coisas, além de trancar todas as portas sob sua influência.
Romanian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Russian: Оберег излучает сильную ауру, не позволяющую другим викингам строить. Он также запирает все двери в пределах своего влияния.
Serbian: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Slovak: The Ward emits a strong aura that prevents other vikings from building things. It also locks all doors within its influence.
Spanish: La piedra guardiana emite un aura poderosa que impide que los demás vikingos construyan cosas. También cierra las puertas que estén bajo su influencia.
Swedish: Gårdsvakten utsöndrar en stark magi som hindrar utomstående från att bygga i närheten. Den låser även dörrar inom dess omnejd.
Thai: วอร์ดมีออร่าแข็งแกร่งมันจะป้องกันไม่ให้ผู้อื่นสร้างสิ่งก่อสร้างในเขตแดน และล็อคประตูกับกล่องสมบัติ. ตั้งหลวงปู่เค็มซะ
Turkish: Nazar, diğer vikinglerin bir şeyler inşa etmesini engelleyen güçlü bir aura yayar. Ayrıca etkisi altındaki kapıları da kilitler.
Ukrainian: Оберіг випромінює сильну ауру, яка забороняє іншим вікінгам щось будувати поблизу. Окрім того, він замикає від чужих усі двері в області своєї дії.

Thai: ฮูกิ้น: เตาหลอม

Spanish: Has construido un horno de fundición
Thai: คุณสร้างเตาหลอมสำเร็จ

English:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Abenaki:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Bulgarian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Chinese:
将你的原矿石放进这台冶炼炉里，它会熔化里面所有的杂质，这样你就能得到纯净的钢材以锻造。 

你会需要<color=yellow>木炭</color>来启动冶炼炉，木炭的生产需要建造一个木炭窑并往里面添上木头。
Croatian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Czech:
Vlož surovou rudu do této pece a ta roztaví všechny nečistoty a vrátí ti cihlu z rafinovaného kovu kterou můžeš zpracovat v Kovadlině.

K pohánění huti budeš potřebovat <color=yellow>Uhlí</color>, které lze vyrobit postavením pece pro spálení dřeva.
Danish:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Dutch:
Stop je onbewerkte erts in deze oven en het smelt alle onzuiverheden weg, waardoor je een staaf geraffineerd metaal overhoudt om mee te werken in de smidse.

De smelterij gebruikt <color=yellow>kool</color> als brandstof, wat kan worden geproduceerd door het bouwen van een houtskoolbrander en daar hout in te steken.
Estonian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Finnish:
Syötä kaikki raakamalmisi tähän uuniin ja se sulattaa pois kaikki epäpuhtaudet, jättäen jälkeensä harkon käsiteltyä metallia, jota voit työstää Takomossa.

Tarvitset <color=yellow>Kivihiiltä</color> Sulatusuunin polttoaineeksi. Tätä voit valmistaa lataamalla Hiiliuunin täyteen puulla.
French:
Stockez votre minerai brut dans ce four pour le faire fondre et le débarrasser de ses impuretés, et obtenir un lingot de métal que vous pouvez travailler dans la forge.

Il vous faudra du <color=yellow>charbon</color> pour alimenter la fonderie, que vous pouvez produire en construisant un four un charbon et en le remplissant de bois.
Georgian:
მოათავსეთ დასამუშავებელი მადანი ღუმელში რათა განიწმინდოს ყველანაირი ჭუწყისაგან, ბოლოს კი დამუშავებული მეტალის ზოდი დაგრჩებათ სამჭედლოსთვის.

სადნობისთვის <color=yellow>ნახშირი</color> დაგჭირდებათ, მისი გამომუშავება კი ღუმელში შეშის დაწვით შიძლება.
German:
Platziere dein Roherz in diesem Hochofen, damit er alle Unreinheiten hinfortschmelzt und du einen Barren veredelten Metalls erhältst, den du für die Schmiede verwenden kannst.

Um den Schmelzofen anzutreiben, benötigst du <color=yellow>Kohle</color>. Kohle wird produziert, indem du einen Kohlenmeiler errichtest und ihn mit Holz füllst.
Greek:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Hindi:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Hungarian:
Helyezd el a nyers ércedet ebben az olvasztókemencében, és kiolvasztja belőle az összes szennyeződést, így egy rúd finomított fém dolgozni a kovácsműhelyben.

<color=yellow>Szénre</color> lesz szükséged az olvasztókemence ellátásához. Azt úgy állíthatsz elő, ha építesz egy égetőkemencét, és megpakolod fával.
Icelandic:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Italian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Japanese:
鉱石の原石をこの炉に入れれば、すべての不純物が溶け出し、あとには精錬された金属の塊だけが残る。 これを鍛冶場で使うことができる。 

溶解炉の燃料として<color=yellow>炭</color>が必要だ。 これは窯を作り、木を入れて作ることができる。
Korean:
가공되지 않은 광석을 이 제련소에 넣으면 불순물들이 모두 녹아내려 대장간에서 작업 가능한 막대 형태의 금속 만이 남게 되지.

제련소는 <color=yellow>석탄</color>이라는 연료를 필요로 하는데, 석탄은 가마에 나무를 넣어 만들 수 있다네.
Lithuanian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Macedonian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Norwegian:
Legg råmalm i denne ovnen og den vil smelte vekk alt unødvendig materiale og etterlate deg med en barre av raffinert metall du kan bruke i en Smed.

Du vil trenge <color=yellow>Kull</color> som brensel i Smelteverket, dette kan du skaffe ved å bygge en Kullovn og fylle den med Treverk.
Polish:
Włóż surową rudę do tego pieca, by stopić wszystkie zanieczyszczenia i otrzymać sztabkę rafinowanego metalu do obróbki w kuźni. Do rozpalenia pieca

będziesz potrzebować <color=yellow>węgla</color>, który można wytworzyć, budując piec i dokładając do niego drewna.
Portuguese:
Deposita o teu minério bruto nesta furnalha e ela irá derreter todas as impurezas, deixando-te com uma barra de metal refinado para usar na forja.

Vais precisar de <color=yellow>Carvão</color> para alimentar a furnalha, que pode ser produzido ao construir um forno e depositando Madeira.
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Deposite minério bruto nesta fornalha para derreter todas as impurezas até que sobre apenas uma barra de metal refinado, que pode ser trabalhada na forja.

Você vai precisar de <color=yellow>carvão</color> para abastecer a fundição. Para produzir carvão, construa um forno e encha com madeira.
Romanian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Russian:
Поместите сюда необработанную руду, чтобы избавиться от примесей и получить кусок очищенного металла для обработки в кузнице.

Чтобы разжечь плавильню, вам понадобится <color=yellow>уголь</color>. Чтобы получить его, постройте печь и заполните ее древесиной.
Serbian:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Slovak:
Deposit your raw ore in this furnace and it will melt away all impurities, leaving you with a bar of refined metal to work at the Forge.

You will need <color=yellow>Coal</color> to fuel the Smelter, this can be produced by building a Kiln and loading it with Wood.
Spanish:
Coloca las menas de mineral en bruto en este horno. Se derretirán todas las impurezas y quedará un lingote de metal refinado que podrás utilizar en la forja.

Para ponerlo en marcha necesitarás <color=yellow>carbón</color>; podrás conseguirlo si construyes un horno de carbón y lo llenas de madera.
Swedish:
Fyll den här ungen med malm och smält väck dess orenheter, tills blott ren metall kvarstår. Den kan du bearbeta i Smedjan.

Endast <color=yellow>Kol</color> brinner tillräckligt varmt. Bygg en Kolmila och fyll den med trä. Eller bränn mat i mängder.
Thai:
หลอมแร่ดิบได้ในเตาหลอมนี้เพื่อขจัดสิ่งสกปรก และทำให้ได้แร่บริสุทธิ์ แล้วจะสามารถนำไปใช้ในโต๊ะงานเหล็กได้

จะต้องใช้ <color=yellow>ถ่าน</color> เป็นเชื้อเพลิงในเตาหลอม ซึ่งถ่านหาได้จากการใช้ไม้ยัดลงในเตาเผาถ่าน
Turkish:
Ham madenlerini bu fırına koyduğunda işleme sonrası Ocak'ta kullanabileceğin işlenmiş külçe metal elde edersin.

Dökümhane'ni çalıştırmak için <color=yellow>Kömüre</color> ihtiyacın olacak. Kömüre ihtiyacın olduğunda Kömür Ocağı inşa ederek içine Ahşap atabilirsin.
Ukrainian:
Складай сирець сюди й дивися, як перетоплюються та щезають всілякі домішки, лишаючи тобі зливки очищеного металу, готового до обробки на ковальні.
 
Плавильні потрібне <color=yellow>вугілля</color>. Збудуй піч і закидай туди дрова.

Thai: ฮูกิ้น: เข้ามาสิ

Chinese: 睡吧，睡吧我亲爱的宝贝！
Dutch: Een rustplaats voor wie moe is!
Swedish: En plats att vila ditt huvud!
Thai: พักผ่อนให้หนายเหนื่อย

English:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Abenaki:
Chakwsi kd'abonek niji k'tokon ali wlamalsia ta ginlôzia. 

Kdak kagui ali kiziba mawitoa tojiwi wigia wlitôzikkil paksal meniwi. K'kizi wlahla tônitta kagui pasek. <color=yellow> Wlidahôzimek majimiwi akwjagadakil awakôganal ta ayhimal</color>, ali wskebiba kaguitta majilosaik li kiak illakannian...
Bulgarian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Chinese:
晚上好好的睡一觉，醒来时才能有满满的力量和振作的精神来迎接新一天的挑战。 

有家的另一个好处就是，你可以制作一些可以保存物品的宝箱。 <color=yellow>你最好随时都有一些备用的武器和装备</color>，以备不时之需，比如你在探索时如果不幸出了什么意外....
Croatian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Czech:
Spi celou noc ve své posteli a probuď se svěží a plní energie.

Další vylepšení tvého domova by byly nějaké truhly, kam si můžeš uložit věci. <color=yellow> Je dobrým zvykem mít vždy nějaké náhradní vybavení </color>, pokud by se ti při zkoumání stalo něco nešťastného...
Danish:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Dutch:
Slaap 's nachts lekker in je bed, en word uitgerust en vol energie wakker.

Je kunt je huis verder verbeteren door wat kisten te plaatsen waarin je items kunt opslaan. <color=yellow>Het is een goed idee om wat reserve-uitrusting te hebben</color>, voor het geval je tijdens je avonturen iets onfortuinlijks overkomt…
Estonian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Finnish:
Nuku yön yli sängyssäsi ja herää levänneenä ja täynnä energiaa.

Toinen parannus jonka voit tehdä kotiisi on rakentaa laatikoita, joihin voit säilöä tavaraa. <color=yellow>On viisasta aina säilyttää ylimääräisiä varusteita</color>, jos sinulle sattuu tapahtumaan jotakin, kun tutkit ympäristöäsi...
French:
Dormez dans votre lit pour vous réveiller le matin en débordant d'énergie.

Améliorez aussi votre maison en y ajoutant des coffres, pour y stocker vos objets. <color=yellow>Il vaut mieux toujours avoir de l'équipement en plus</color>, au cas où il arriverait quelque chose pendant que vous êtes en pleine exploration...
Georgian:
გამოიძინეთ ღამით საწოლში და შეხვდით ახალი დღეს ახალი ენერგიით!

სახლის გასაძლიერებლად კარგი იქნება სუნდუკები, სადაც შეძლებთ ნივთების შენახვას.<color=yellow>ყოველთვის კარგი პრაქტიკაა გქონდეთ დამატებითი აბჯარი</color>, იმ შემთხვევისთვის თუ რამე უბედურება შეგემთხვევა გზად...
German:
Verbringe die Nacht in deinem Bett, um gestärkt und voller Energie zu erwachen.

Eine weitere Verbesserung deines Eigenheims würden ein paar Kisten darstellen, in denen du Gegenstände lagern kannst. <color=yellow>Es ist nie verkehrt, immer ein wenig Ersatzausrüstung vorrätig zu haben</color> - nur für den Fall, dass dir während deiner Erkundungen irgendetwas Unvorhersehbares zustoßen sollte...
Greek:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Hindi:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Hungarian:
Aludd át az éjszakát az ágyadban, és ébredj felfrissülve, tele energiával!

Egy újabb fejlesztést az otthonodban néhány láda jelentene, ahol eltárolhatod a tárgyakat. <color=yellow>Mindig jó ötlet felszerelést tartaléknak félretenni</color>, ha valami szerencsétlenség történne veled felfedezés közben...
Icelandic:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Italian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Japanese:
ベッドで一晩眠れば、爽やかな気持ちで活力一杯の目覚めが迎えられる。 

さらに、物を保管しておけるチェストをいくつか作れば家がより良い場所となる。 <color=yellow>装備には、常に予備を持つようにしておくといいだろう</color>。 探索中に不幸に見舞われることもあろうし...
Korean:
침대에서 하룻밤 푹 자고 나면 상쾌한 기분으로 활력 넘치는 아침을 맞을 수 있지. 

그대의 집에 필요한 또 다른 개선점으로는 아이템들을 보관 할 수 있는 상자를 들 수 있겠군. <color=yellow>여분의 장비를 비치해 두는 것은</color> 탐험 도중에 불행한 일이 생겼을 때를 대비할 수 있는 좋은 습관이지...
Lithuanian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Macedonian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Norwegian:
Sov natten bort i sengen din og våkn opp med ny energi.

En annen forbedring til hjemmet ditt vil være noen kister der du kan lagre gjenstander. <color=yellow>Det er en god idé å alltid ha noe reserveutstyr hjemme</color>, dersom noe uheldig skulle skje med deg mens du utforsker...
Polish:
Prześpij całą noc w swoim łóżku i obudź się wypoczętym i pełnym energii.

Kolejnym ulepszeniem twojego domu mogą być skrzynie, w których przechowasz swoje przedmioty. <color=yellow>Dobrą praktyką jest zawsze mieć przy sobie zapasowe wyposażenie</color>, jeśli podczas eksploracji przytrafi ci się nieszczęście.
Portuguese:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Passe a noite na cama para se recuperar e acordar com muito mais disposição.

Outra melhoria em sua casa seriam baús para guardar objetos. <color=yellow>É uma boa ideia sempre ter equipamentos de sobra</color>, caso você sofra algum infortúnio durante suas explorações…
Romanian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Russian:
Спите всю ночь напролет в своей кровати и просыпайтесь в бодром состоянии и с полным запасом энергии.

Еще одним улучшением вашего дома могут стать сундуки для хранения предметов. <color=yellow>Хорошо всегда иметь при себе запасное снаряжение</color> на случай, если с вами случится что-то неприятное во время исследования...
Serbian:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Slovak:
Sleep the night away in your bed and awaken feeling refreshed and full of energy.

Another improvement to your home would be some chests where you can store items. <color=yellow>It is good practice to always have some spare equipment</color>, if something unfortunate should happen to you while exploring...
Spanish:
Duerme a pierna suelta en la cama y te despertarás con las energías recargadas por completo.

También puedes colocar cofres en casa para guardar objetos y, de paso, mejorar tu morada. <color=yellow>Nunca está de más tener equipo de repuesto</color> por si te ocurre alguna desgracia cuando salgas a explorar...
Swedish:
Sov bort nattens timmar i sängen och vakna uppfriskad och full av energi.

En annan förbättring till ditt hem vore lite kistor att lagra föremål i. Det är en god vana att <color=yellow>spara lite reservutrustning</color> för oförutsedda eventualiteter...
Thai:
นอนหลับเต็มตื่นบนเตียง แล้วตื่นขึ้นมาอย่างสดชื่นและมีพลังอีกครั้ง

ปรับปรุงบ้านของคุณและลองวางกล่องเก็บของสักอันไว้เก็บของ <color=yellow>ควรมีอุปกรณ์สำรองเก็บไว้บ้าง</color> หากเกิดเหตุไม่คาดฝันตอนท่องโลก มันน่าจะช่วยคุณได้
Turkish:
Geceyi yatağında uyuyarak geçirirsen sabaha dinç ve enerjin dolu bir şekilde uyanırsın.

Evindeki olmazsa olmazlardan biri de eşyalarını depolayabileceğin sandıklardır. Keşif yaparken talihsiz bir durum yaşama ihtimaline karşı <color=yellow>yedek ekipman bulundurmak her zaman önemlidir</color>...
Ukrainian:
Якщо спати вночі у власному ліжку, то на ранок прокинешся бадьорим і відпочилим.
 
Ще в оселі можна поставити скрині та зберігати там свої пожитки. <color=yellow>Завше непогано мати запасне спорядження</color> — на випадок, якщо під час мандрів станеться щось неочікуване…

Thai: ฮูกิ้น: ถูกรุกราน

German: Du wurdest das Opfer einer Invasion
Thai: บ้านกำลังถูกรุกราน

English: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Abenaki: Awaasak k'migakamegokji ni tali wigian nônegwejiwi. Wibiwitta ali ni meliksanian ôda k'pakaldamikhogowi zakozia. Wlito meliki wakwôlodo achi waji kizi ôlebmôwzia!
Bulgarian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Chinese: 敌人会时不时的向你的营地发动进攻。 技能或装备并不能保证你一定能赢，你需要修建更坚固的防护才能抵抗他们的进攻。
Croatian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Czech: Příšery čas od času obléhají tvůj tábor. Síla tvých rukou ti nezaručuje vítězství v těchto situacích, vybuduj silnou obranu, abys předešel bouři!
Danish: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Dutch: Monsters zullen van tijd tot tijd je kamp belagen. Je vechtkunst alleen kan wellicht niet genoeg zijn om je de overwinning te bezorgen, dus bouw een sterke verdediging op om deze aanvallen te doorstaan.
Estonian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Finnish: Viholliset piirittävät leiriäsi aika-ajoin. Aseiden voima ei aina takaa sinulle voittoa näissä tilanteissa, joten rakenna myös vahvat puolustukset, että selviydyt tilanteesta voittajana!
French: Les monstres assiégeront de temps à autre votre camp. La puissance de vos armes ne vous assurera pas toujours la victoire. Établissez une défense solide pour encaisser l'attaque !
Georgian: დრო და დრო მონსტრები შეეცდებიან შემოიჭრან თქვენ ბანაკში. ძლიერი იარაღი არ გაძლევთ გარანტიას ამ სიტუაციაში, ასე რომ ააშენეთ ძლიერი დაცვა - ისეთი შტორმსაც რომ გაუძლოს!
German: Von Zeit zu Zeit wird dein Lager das Ziel herumstreunender Monster. Da dir in diesen Fällen starke Waffen nicht den Sieg garantieren, solltest du in Erwägung ziehen, eine starke Verteidigung zu errichten, die mächtig genug ist, um alle Eindringlinge in die Flucht zu schlagen.
Greek: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Hindi: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Hungarian: Időről időre szörnyek veszik majd ostrom alá a táborodat. A fegyverek ereje nem garantálja a győzelmet efféle helyzetekben. Építs erős védelmet, hogy ellenállj a viharnak!
Icelandic: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Italian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Japanese: 時々、怪物が野営地を襲うことがある。 このような場合には、自分の腕力で必ず勝てるとは限らない。 嵐を切り抜けるための強い防御を作るのだ！
Korean: 때때로 몬스터들은 그대의 캠프를 공격하기 위해 몰려올 거라네. 개인의 무력이 강하여도 곧장 승리로 이어지지 않을 수 있지, 강력한 수비 건물을 지어 폭풍을 몰아내게!
Lithuanian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Macedonian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Norwegian: Monstre vil angripe bostedet ditt fra tid til annen. Våpenstyrke vil kanskje ikke alltid sikre deg seier, sørg også for å ha et kraftig forsvar til de trekker seg tilbake!
Polish: Potwory będą regularnie dokonywać oblężenia twojego obozu. W takich przypadkach siła broni nie zagwarantuje ci zwycięstwa, dlatego stwórz silną obronę, aby przetrwać szturm!
Portuguese: Monstros vão atacar o teu acampamento de tempos em tempos. A força de armas não garante a vitória nessas situações, constrói uma defesa forte para resistir à tempestade!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Monstros podem cercar seu acampamento de tempos em tempos, e o poder de ataque não é garantia de vitória em situações assim. Melhor armar uma defesa poderosa e aguentar o tranco!
Romanian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Russian: Время от времени монстры будут вторгаться в ваш лагерь. Мощность оружия не гарантирует вам победу в таких ситуациях. Постройте сильную оборону, чтобы выдержать нашествие!
Serbian: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Slovak: Monsters will lay siege to your camp from time to time. Strength of arms does not guarantee you victory in these situations, build a strong defence to weather out the storm!
Spanish: De vez en cuando, los monstruos asediarán tu campamento. La fuerza de las armas no te garantiza la victoria en estas situaciones, por lo que tendrás que construir una defensa consistente para salir indemne de estas calamidades.
Swedish: Skogens väsen kommer försöka belägra dig emellanåt. I dessa lägen kanske inte rå vapenstyrka räcker! Bygg ett starkt försvar för att säkerställa din seger mot inkräktarna.
Thai: มอนเตอร์จะมาบุกบ้านคุณในบ้างครั้ง ความแข็งแกร่งของอาวุธไม่ได้รับประกันว่าจะชนะในศึกนี้ จงสร้างสิ่งป้องกันและผ่านศึกนี้ไปให้ได้!
Turkish: Yaratıklar zaman zaman kampını kuşatabilirler. Bu gibi durumlardan bilek gücüne güvenemezsin, hayatta kalmak için güçlü savunmalar inşa et!
Ukrainian: Час від часу чудовиська братимуть твій табір в облогу. У таких випадках міцні руки не гарантують перемогу — ліпше збудувати міцну огорожу й перечекати це нашестя!

Thai: ว่าไงนักรบ
ยินดีที่ได้พบท่าน
ข้ามีข่าวมาบอก
กา กา!

Hungarian: Vajon ez egy mezei egér volt...
Thai: นั่นเป็นทุ่งนา
อากาศดีนะ...
หินอักษรรูน
เผาลูกหลานของเขา

Japanese: 彼女の子を犠牲とせよ
Thai: บูชายัญไข่เชื้อสายของเธอ

English: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Abenaki: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Bulgarian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Chinese: 他那即将消散的灵魂浸入了他身体里的每一部分！
Croatian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Czech: A JEHO UMÍRAJÍCÍ DUŠI BUDE ROZDĚLENA A SDÍLENA MEZI VŠECHNY JEHO RODY
Danish: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Dutch: EN ZIJN STERFELIJKE ZIEL WERD OPGESPLITST EN VERDEELD ONDER ZIJN NAASTEN
Estonian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Finnish: JA HÄNEN KUOLEVA SIELUNSA JAETTIIN KAIKKIEN HÄNEN SUKULAISTENSA KESKEN
French: ET SON ÂME MOURANTE FUT DIVISÉE ET PARTAGÉE ENTRE LES SIENS
Georgian: და მისი მომაკვდავი სული დანაწევრებული იყო!
German: UND SEINE STERBENDE SEELE WURDE GESPALTEN UND UNTER DEN SEINEN AUFGETEILT
Greek: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Hindi: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Hungarian: HALDOKLÓ LELKE KETTÉHASAD, ÉS SZÉTOSZLOTT AZ ÖSSZES FAJTÁRSA KÖZÖTT.
Icelandic: DEYJANDI SÁL HANS VAR DEILT MILLI ALLRA ÆTTINGJA HANS
Italian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Japanese: そして彼の死につつある魂はその親族の間で分け与えられた
Korean: 그리고 그의 죽어가는 영혼은 갈라져 그의 모든 일족에게 공유되었으니
Lithuanian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Macedonian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Norwegian: OG HANS DØENDE SJEL VAR SPLITTET OG DELT BLANDT ALLE HANS LIKE
Polish: A JEGO UMIERAJĄCA DUSZA ZOSTAŁA PODZIELONA I TRAFIŁA W RĘCE JEGO RODU
Portuguese: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Portuguese_Brazilian: E SUA ALMA MORIBUNDA FRAGMENTOU-SE E ESPALHOU-SE ENTRE A FAMÍLIA DELE
Romanian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Russian: И ЕГО СМЕРТНАЯ ДУША БЫЛА РАЗДЕЛЕНА НА ВЕСЬ ЕГО РОД
Serbian: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Slovak: AND HIS DYING SOUL WAS SPLIT AND SHARED AMONG ALL HIS KIN
Spanish: SU ALMA MORIBUNDA SE DIVIDIÓ Y SE REPARTIÓ ENTRE LOS SUYOS
Swedish: OCH HANS DÖENDE SJÄL BLAND SINA FRÄNDER FÖRDELADES
Thai: และวิญญาณที่กำลังจะตายของเขาก็แยกออก และแบ่งปันกันในหมู่ญาติทั้งหมดของพวกเขา
Turkish: VE CAN ÇEKİŞEN RUHU PARÇALARA BÖLÜNÜP SOYDAŞLARIYLA PAYLAŞILDI
Ukrainian: І РОЗДІЛИЛАСЯ ЙОГО ДУША, І ОТРИМАВ ЇЇ ШМАТКИ УВЕСЬ ЙОГО РІД

English:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Abenaki:
Agwa nôwad, salakiwi Odin, wmitôgwes mziwi, tojiwi ônkawtokeza akial. W'kibakôlôt wd'apchigôbijik taliwi mdala alagimgwak akik niga w'psighamenel nilil pskaôdkwenol enni anokawô apchwi Akiakwamek ali chigitawôt tôwitowasohodit miwyalômek…

 Kwôkwaniwi, ni aki aoskôbizo nidaki ôda machino... ali msalok paiyômoo nôbi toji pkwami msadwaskadek ni sabasigan, kinjameswidebaldamwôganal zôkhihla ni tojiwi zokwihla toji Niwaskok ôdahaba kizi namitohodit. 

Pami Odin alstamid wd'apchigôbijik alemi mliksanohodid ni Odin w'kinamen nanôwikik niga w'pjidakôn w'valkryriesmak waji kizi kwilawahôhôdit ôtalli mameliksanijik. Ôlawi machinak u akik, bemôwzoikhozoak mina…

…wskijiwi VALHEIMEK!
Bulgarian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Chinese:
在很久很久以前，诸神之父奥丁统领着整个世界。 他打败了所有的敌人并把他们抛入了第十大神界，然后把支撑这炼狱的巨木劈开，取了其中一块变成了世界之树，并让它孤零零地留在了这被遗忘的放逐者之境...


数百年以来，这个世界虽在沉睡，但实则躁动不安。 但是，它并没有死去...一整个冰川世纪过去了，王朝兴起又衰落，而诸神并不知晓。 


当奥丁听说他的敌人们正在重新生长，恢复力量，他派出了女武神们到人界为他找到最勇猛的战士们。 他们在人界已经死去，而他们即将重生在...


...英灵神殿！
Croatian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Czech:
Kdysi dávno Otec Veškerenstva Ódin spojil světy. Uvrhl své nepřátele do desátého světa, poté rozdělil větve, které držely jejich vězení, na Světový strom a nechal ho bez ukotvení plout, toto místo vyhoštění... 



Po staletí tento svět neklidně spal. Ale nezemřel... Jak doby ledové ubíhaly, království povstávala a mizela z dohledu bohů.



Když Ódin zaslechl, jak jeho nepřátelé opět sílí, pohlédl na Midgard a poslal své Valkýry, aby prohledaly bitevní pole pro nejlepší z válečníků. Mrtví ve svém světě, nastal čas, aby se znovu zrodili...


…ve VALHEIMU!
Danish:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Dutch:
Lang geleden verenigde Alvader Odin de werelden. Hij versloeg zijn vijanden en veroordeelde ze tot de tiende wereld, en spleet daarna de takken die hun gevangenis verbond met de wereldboom, waardoor het afdreef, zonder anker, een verbannen plek…



Al eeuwen verkeert deze plek onwennig in ruste, maar stierf niet… IJstijden gingen voorbij, en koninkrijken kwamen en gingen buiten het zicht van de goden.



Toen Odin hoorde dat zijn vijanden wederom sterker werden, keerde hij zich tot Midgard en stuurde zijn Walkuren om op de slagvelden te zoeken naar de beste krijger. Dood voor de wereld zou deze persoon worden herboren…



…in VALHEIM!
Estonian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Finnish:
Kauan aikaa sitten, Kaikkivaltias Odin yhdisti maailmat. Hän päihitti vihollisensa ja langetti heidät kymmenenteen maailmaan, jonka jälkeen hän halkaisi oksat jotka piti heidän vankilansa kiinni Maailmanpuussa, ja jätti sen ajelehtimaan paikkana karkoitetuille…



Vuosisatojen ajan, tämä maailma uinui rauhattomasti. Mutta se ei kuollut... Kun jääkylmät ajat vierivät ohitse, kuningaskunnat nousivat ja kaatuivat ilman silmäystäkään Jumalilta.



Kun Odin kuuli että hänen vihollisiensa voimat olivat kasvamassa jälleen, hän katsoi Midgardiin ja lähetti hänen Valkyriansa lävitse taistelukenttien, etsien heidän mahtavimpia sotureitaan. Kuolleina maailmalle, he syntyivät uudestaan…



…VALHEIMISSA!
French:
Il y a bien longtemps, Odin, le Père de Toute Chose, réunit les mondes. Il abattit ses ennemis et les jeta dans le dixième monde, et divisa les branches qui le rattachaient à l'Arbre-monde. Il laissa dériver ce monde d'exil, sans attaches...



Pendant des siècles, ce monde plongea dans un sommeil agité. Mais il ne mourut pas... Les ères glaciaires passèrent, des royaumes s'élevèrent et s'écroulèrent et échappèrent au regard des dieux.



Quand Odin apprit que ses ennemis recouvraient leurs forces, il se tourna vers Midgard et envoya ses Valkyries sillonner les champs de bataille, à la recherche des guerriers les plus valeureux. Une fois morts dans leur monde, ils renaîtraient...



... à VALHEIM !
Georgian:
დიდი ხნის წინათ, ოდინმა გააერთიანა სამყარო. მან თავისი მტრები დაამარცხა და მეათე სამყაროში გამოკეტა.


საუკუნეების განმავლობაში ამ სამყაროს ეძინა. მაგრამ არ მომკვდარა... სანამ ყინული დნებოდა, ამოდიოდა და ჩადიოდა მეათე სამყაროს მზე ღმერთების ყურადღების გარეშე.


როცა ოდინმა გაიგო რომ მისი მტრები ისევ იკრებდნენ ძალებს, მიაპყრო მზერა მიდგარდს და გაგზავნა თავისი ვალკირიები რომ ეპოვნათ უდიდესი მეომრები. მკვდრები, ისინი ისევ აღსდგებიან...


ვალჰეიმში!
German:
Vor langer Zeit vereinte Allvater Odin die Welten. Nachdem er seine Feinde niedergerungen hatte, schleuderte er sie auf die 10. Welt, bevor er die Zweige des Weltenbaums spaltete, die ihre Gefängnisse trugen. Dadurch gab er sie einem Exil anheim, in dem sie ankerlos umhertreiben würden…



Diese Welt fiel jahrhundertelang in einen unbehaglichen Schlaf. Doch dies war nicht ihr Ende… Denn während Eiszeiten kamen und gingen, so entstanden auch Königreiche, die sich der Sicht der Götter entzogen.



Als Odin vernahm, dass seine einstigen Feinde erneut erstarkt waren, schaute er gen Midgard und entsandte seine Walküren, um die Schlachtfelder nach den größten Kriegern zu durchsuchen. Wenngleich tot, würden sie neu geboren werden…



…in VALHEIM!
Greek:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Hindi:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Hungarian:
Réges-régen a Mindenatya, Odin egyesítette a világokat. Legyőzte az ellenségeit, és a tizedik világba vetette őket, majd szétválasztotta a börtönüket a világfához rögzítő ágakat, és hagyta szabadon sodródni a száműzetésük helyét…



Ez a világ évszázadokon át nyugtalanul szunnyadt, de nem pusztult el... Jégkorszakok múlásával királyságok emelkedtek fel, és buktak el az istenek szeme láttára.



Amikor Odin meghallotta, hogy ellenségei ismét erőt gyűjtenek, Midgardra tekintett, és elküldte a valkűrjeit, hogy kutassák át a csatatereket a legnagyobb harcosaik után, akik a világ szemében halottak, és újraszülethetnek…



... VALHEIMBEN!
Icelandic:
Fyrir löngu síðan sameinaði Alfaðir Óðinn himnana. Hann fleygði fjandamenn hanns og kastaði þeim í tíunda heimin, síðan kljóf trjágreinarnar sem hélt þeim fanga að heimstrénu. Lét það svo fjúka ótryggt, útlegðarstaður...


Öldum saman svaf þessi heimur órólegur. Enn það dó ekki... þegar ísaldir liðu, konungsríku rósu, féllu og fóru svo úr sjónsviði æsana.


Þegar Óðinn heyrði að stirkur fjandamenn hanns voru að aukast leit hann til Miðgarðar og senti Valkyrjur sínar að vígvöllum í leitar af sterkustu stríðsmenn þeirra. Dauðir fyrir heimin, þeir mundu verða endurfæddir...


... í VALHEIM!
Italian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Japanese:
はるか昔、最高神たるオーディンはすべての世界を一つにした。 彼は敵を倒し、第10世界に追放した後、その牢獄を世界樹に結びつけていた大枝を裂き、それを漂うに任せて流罪の場所とした...



何百年もの間、この世界は落ち着かぬ眠りを貪っていた。 しかし死んではいなかった... 氷河の時代が過ぎ、数々の王国が興り、また神々の視界から消えた。 



敵が再び力を蓄えたと聞いたオーディンは、ミズガルズに目を向け、ワルキューレを送り出して戦場で最も偉大な戦士たちを探させた。 世界にとって死んだ者が再び生まれることになる...



...VALHEIMで！
Korean:
오래전, 최고신 오딘은 세계를 통합했습니다. 오딘은 적들을 쓰러뜨리고 열 번째 세계에 던져 넣었으며, 그들의 감옥과 이어진 세계수의 가지들을 잘라 정처 없이 떠도는 망명지로 만들었습니다... 



수 세기 동안, 그 세계는 불안 속에 잠들어 있었습니다. 하지만 멸망하지는 않았죠... 빙하기가 지나감에 따라, 신들의 눈이 닿지 않는 곳에서 수 많은 왕국들이 탄생하고 스러져 갔습니다.



적들이 다시 한번 강해졌다는 소식을 들은 오딘은 미드가르드에 기대를 걸었고 그의 발키리들을 전장으로 보내어 가장 뛰어난 전사들을 찾도록 하였습니다. 세상을 떠난 전사들은, 다시 태어날 것입니다...


...발헤임에서!
Lithuanian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Macedonian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Norwegian:
For lenge siden forente Allfaderen Odin oss alle. Han slo ned sine fiender og sendte dem til den tiende verden, deretter kuttet han Verdenstreets bånd og lot deres nye fengsel drifte uankret, det perfekte stedet til de forviste...


I århundrer lå denne verdenen i en urolig søvn. Den døde aldri... Flere istider passerte, kongeriker blomstret og falt utenfor gudenes syn.


Da Odin fikk høre at hans fiender igjen samlet kreftene sine, så han ned mot Midgard og sendte Valkyriene for å finkjemme slagmarken etter de mektigste krigerne. Døde til verden, men gjenfødt...


...i VALHEIM!
Polish:
Dawno temu Wszechojciec Odyn zjednoczył światy. Zrzucił swoich wrogów ze szczytu do Dziesiątego świata, a następnie rozłupał konary, w których byli więzieni, na Drzewo świata i zostawił je, aby dryfowało bez końca, tworząc ich miejsce wygnania…



Przez wieki mieszkańcy tego świata w obawie nie mogli spać spokojnie. Jednak udało im się przetrwać… Gdy minęły epoki lodowcowe, królestwa powstawały i znikały z pola widzenia bogów.



Odyn słysząc, że jego wrogowie znów rosną w siłę, spojrzał na Midgard i wysłał swoje walkirie, by udały się na pola bitwy w poszukiwaniu najmężniejszych wojowników. Umarli dla świata narodziliby się ponownie…



… w VALHEIM!
Portuguese:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.



When Odin heard his enemies were growing once again in strength, he looked to Midgard and sent his Valkyries to scour the battlefields for the greatest of their warriors. Dead to the world, they would be born again…



…in VALHEIM!
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Há muito tempo, Odin Pai de Todos uniu os mundos. Ele derrotou seus inimigos e lançou-os ao décimo mundo, depois cortou os galhos que mantinham a prisão da Árvore-Mundo e deixou-a solta, à deriva, um lugar de exílio…



Por séculos, este mundo teve um sono inquieto: adormecido, porém vivo… Com o passar da era glacial, reinos surgiram e desapareceram diante dos deuses.



Quando Odin ouviu que seus inimigos estavam se recuperando, ele voltou sua atenção a Midgard e enviou as Valquírias rumo aos campos de batalha, em busca dos maiores guerreiros que pudessem encontrar. Mortos para o mundo, eles nasceriam de novo…



… em VALHEIM!
Romanian:
Long ago, the Allfather Odin united the worlds. He threw down his foes and cast them into the tenth world, then split the boughs that held their prison to the World-Tree, and left it to drift unanchored, a place of exile…



For centuries, this world slumbered uneasily. But it did not die... As glacial ages passed, kingdoms rose and fell out of sight of the gods.
