English: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Abenaki: Naoji niuna n'meskawônnawak lagwiwi nigik li wajoikok. Nd'aibenop nisinska nikwôbidaki nisoak niuna nôniziwi. Agda ôptchi kadona, basojiwi taliwi w'lawôganek aik Draugr w'tiskwôdi. Chebiwi yo senek n'sidaldamô negemikannit tojiwi kizi machinak niji n'bidhakanga w'skwedaibegi alômiwi alômsek. Nigaji n'kwelbôbin li ôtalli wskwaadenek waji kizi kwilawahok na welegwanoid. Odin chigitawi machinaa ala medawinnohlaa ni alach.
Bulgarian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Chinese: 我们几个找到了去凛冽雪山的路。 我们开始有二十人，现在剩下两人。 阿格达快要死去了，她的心被一只尸鬼箭射中。 我将会在这块石碑旁给她举行一场告别仪式并把她的骨灰撒进风中。 然后我会将我的脸转向最高的地方并找到那对翅膀。 愿奥丁赐予我荣耀或是死亡。
Croatian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Czech: Málo z nás našlo cestu k těmto horám. Bylo nás dvacet a nyní jsme dva. Agda umírá. Draugský šíp leží blízko jejího srdce. Rozloučím se s ní vedle tohoto kamene a odevzdám její popel větru. Pak odvrátím svou tvář k nejvyššímu vrcholu a vyhledám Okřídleného. Nechť mi Ódin přinese smrt nebo slávu.
Danish: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Dutch: Weinigen van ons wisten de bergen te bereiken. Waar we eerst met twintig waren, zijn er nu nog twee over. Agda is stervende, en een draugenpijl heeft haar nabij haar hart doorboort. Ik zeg haar vaarwel naast deze steen, en zal haar as aan de wind geven. Daarna wend ik mijn blik tot de hoogste piek en zoek ik de Gevleugelde. Moge Odin me glorie brengen, dan wel de dood.
Estonian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Finnish: Jotkut meistä päätyivät näille vuorille. Aluksi meitä oli kaksikymmentä, nyt kaksi. Agda tekee kuolemaa; draugrin nuoli osui lähelle hänen sydäntään. Jätän hänelle hyvästit tämän kiven vierellä ja lasken hänen tuhkansa tuuleen. Sitten käännän katseeni korkeinta huippua kohti ja etsin Siivekkään. Suokoon Odin minulle kuolon tai kunnian.
French: Peu d'entre nous ont trouvé le chemin de ces montagnes. Nous étions vingt et nous ne sommes plus que deux. Agda est mourante, une flèche Draugr fichée près de son cœur. Je lui dirai adieu près de cette pierre et offrirai ses cendres au vent. Je me tournerai ensuite vers le plus haut pic et chercherai l'Ailée. Qu'Odin m'accorde mort et gloire.
Georgian: ცოტამ თუ იპოვა გზა მთებამდე. ოცნი ვიყავით და ახლა კი ორი ვართ. აგდა კვდება, დრაუგრის ნასროლი ისარი მის გულშია გაჭედილი. დავემშვიდობები ამ ქვასთან და ქარს გავატან მის ფერფლს. შემდეგ სახლით ამ მთისკენ შვტრიალდები და წავალ იმ ფრთიანთან შესახვედრად. დაე ოდინმა მარგუნოს სიკვდილი ან დიდება.
German: Nur wenige von uns fanden ihren Weg in diese Berge. Wir waren einst zwanzig, doch nur sind wir nur noch zwei. Agda liegt im Sterben. Neben ihrem Herz befindet sich ein Draugr-Pfeil. Ich werde mich neben diesem Stein von ihr verabschieden und ihre Asche den Winden übergeben. Dann werde ich mich dem höchsten Gipfel zuwenden und den Geflügelten aufsuchen. Möge Odin mir Ruhm geben … oder Tod.
Greek: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Hindi: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Hungarian: Kevesen találtuk meg az ezekbe a hegyekbe vezető utat. Huszan voltunk, és mostanra ketten maradtunk. Agda haldoklik, egy draugr nyílvessző a szíve közelében találta el. Elbúcsúzom tőle ezen kő mellett, és hamvait a szélnek eresztem. Azután a legmagasabb csúcs felé fordulok, és megkeresem a szárnyast. Odin biztosítson nekem halált vagy dicsőséget!
Icelandic: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Italian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Japanese: これらの山に足を踏み入れる者は少なかった。 最初は二十人いたものが、今では二人だ。 アグダは死にかけている。 ドラウグルの矢が心臓の近くに刺さったのだ。 私はこの石の近くで彼女に別れを告げ、彼女の灰を風に飛ばすだろう。 その後、顔を最も高い頂に向けて翼ある者を探すのだ。 オーディンが私に死か栄光をたまわらんことを。
Korean: 이 산에 발을 들여놓는 사람은 거의 없습니다. 처음에는 스무 명이 있었는데 지금은 두 명입니다. 아그다는 죽어가고 있습니다. 드라우그의 화살이 심장 근처에 꽂힌 것입니다. 나는 이 돌 근처에서 그녀에게 작별을 고하고 그녀의 재를 바람에 날릴 것입니다. 그런 다음 내 얼굴을 가장 높은 정상으로 향하게 하고 날개 달린 자를 찾을 것입니다. 오딘이 내게 죽음이나 영광을 주길 바랍니다.
Lithuanian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Macedonian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Norwegian: Noen få av oss har funnet veien til disse fjellene. Vi var tjue og nå er vi to. Agda er døende, en Draugrs pil ligger ved hennes hjerte. Jeg sier mitt farvell ved denne steinen og skal spre asken hennes til vinden. Deretter skal jeg vende ansiktet mot den høyeste fjelltoppen og utfordre Den Vingede. Må Odin gi meg døden eller ære.
Polish: Niewielu z nas trafiło w te góry. Było nas dwadzieścioro, a zostało dwoje. Agda umiera, jej serce przeszyła strzała draugra. Pożegnam się z nią przy tym kamieniu i rozsypię jej prochy na wietrze. Wtedy odwrócę me oblicze ku najwyższemu szczytowi i odszukam Skrzydlatego. Niech Odyn ześle mi śmierć lub chwałę.
Portuguese: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Poucos de nós encontraram o caminho até estas montanhas. Éramos vinte, e agora somos dois. Agda está morrendo, uma flecha dos Draugr aninhada perto de seu coração. Darei adeus a ela ao lado desta pedra e entregarei suas cinzas ao vento. Depois, buscarei o pico mais alto e partirei em busca do Alado. Que Odin me dê morte ou glória.
Romanian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Russian: Мало кто из нас попал в эти горы. Нас было двадцать, а теперь двое. Агда умирает, стрела драугра пронзила ее сердце. Я попрощаюсь с ней у этого камня и развею ее пепел по ветру. Затем повернусь я лицом к высочайшей горе и найду там Крылатого. Да подарит мне Один достойную смерть.
Serbian: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Slovak: Few of us found our way to these mountains. We were twenty and now we are two. Agda is dying, a Draugr arrow lies near her heart. I will bid her farewell beside this stone and give her ashes to the wind. Then I will turn my face to the highest peak and seek out the Winged One. May Odin give me death or glory.
Spanish: No somos muchos los que dimos con el camino hacia estas montañas. Éramos veinte, pero ya solo quedamos dos. Agda, con una flecha de draugr junto al corazón, muere lentamente. Me despediré de ella junto a esta roca y le daré al viento sus cenizas. Después, miraré hacia la cima más alta y buscaré a la Alada. Que Odín me dé la muerte o la gloria.
Swedish: Få av oss fann vägen till dessa höjder. Tjugo var vi, och två är vi nu. Agda är döende, en Draugs pil nära hjärtat. Jag tar farväl brevid denna sten, och lämnar hennes aska till vinden. Sedan vänder jag anletet mot den högsta höjd, där den Bevingade väntar. Må Oden skänka mig ära eller död.
Thai: พวกเราไม่กี่คนพบทางไปภูเขาเหล่านี้ เราอายุยี่สิบและตอนนี้เราสองคน Agda กำลังจะตายลูกศร Draugr อยู่ใกล้หัวใจของเธอ ฉันจะอำลาเธอข้างๆก้อนหินนี้และมอบขี้เถ้าให้เธอตามสายลม จากนั้นฉันจะหันหน้าไปยังจุดสูงสุดและค้นหา Winged One ขอให้โอดินให้ความตายหรือความรุ่งโรจน์แก่ฉัน
Turkish: Pek azımız bu dağların yolunu bulabildi. Sayımız yirmiydi ama şimdi iki kişi kaldık. Agda ölüyor, bir Draugr oku kalbinin yakınına saplandı. Bu taşın yanı başında ona veda edip küllerini rüzgâra savuracağım. Sonra da yüzümü en yüksek tepeye çevirip Kanatlı Varlık'ı arayacağım. Odin bana ya ölüm ya da zafer bahşetsin.
Ukrainian: Мало нас дісталося до цих гір. Було нас двадцять, а лишилося двоє. Аґда вмирає від драуґської стріли, що влучила поблизу серця. Я попрощаюся з нею біля цього каменю й віддам її прах вітру. Потім піду до найвищої вершини й шукатиму Крилату. Най Одін дарує мені смерть або славу.

English: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Abenaki: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Bulgarian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Chinese: 这个标记是我，乌尔夫第一次看见霜龙的地方，那时是我在英灵神殿的第三个夏天。 她在这里留下了一堆沾着鹿骨，鬓猪骨和灰矮人头骨的粪便。 我再也不会到这附近来了。
Croatian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Czech: Toto značí místo, kde já, Ulf, jsem poprvé viděl velkou dračici, třetího léta mého života ve Valheimu. Zastavila se zde a zanechala hromadu trusu, který držel kosti jelenů, kanců a lebku šedého trpaslíka. Nikdy se k tomuto místu více nepřiblížím.
Danish: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Dutch: Dit is een merkteken voor de plek waar ik, Ulf, voor het eerst een grootse draak heb aanschouwd, in mijn derde zomer hier in Valheim. Ze stopte hier en liet een berg mest achter met daarin de botten van een hert en een everzwijn, en de schedel van een grijze dwerg. Ik zal me voortaan verre houden van deze plek.
Estonian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Finnish: Tämä kivi on merkkinä paikassa, jossa minä, Ulf, näin suuren käärmeen ensimmäistä kertaa kolmantena kesänäni Valheimissa. Naaraskäärme laskeutui tehdäkseen tarpeensa, joitten seassa oli peuran luita, villisika ja harmaakääpiön kallo. En palaa tähän paikkaan enää ikinä.
French: Ceci marque l'endroit où moi, Ulf, ai vu la grande Drac pour la première fois, lors du troisième été de ma vie à Valheim. Elle s'est arrêtée pour se soulager d'un tas de fumier contenant des os de cerf, de sanglier et un crâne de Naingris. Je ne reviendrai plus jamais ici.
Georgian: ეს ის ადგილია, სადაც მე, ულფმა. პირველად ვნახე დრაკონი, მესამე ზაფხულს ჩემი ცხოვრებისა ვალჰეიმში. ის აქ გაჩერდა და დატოვა ირმის ძვლების გროვა, ტახების და გრეიდფარფების თავის ქალა. არასოდეს აღარ მივუახლოვდები ამ ადგილს.
German: Diese Stelle markiert den Ort, an dem ich, Ulf, zuerst den großen Drachen erblickte. Während meines dritten Sommers in Valheim. Sie machte hier Rast, um einen Haufen Exkremente zu hinterlassen, der aus den Knochen von Hirschen und Wildschweinen und dem Schädel eines Grauzwergs bestand. Ich werde mich diesem Ort nie wieder nähern.
Greek: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Hindi: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Hungarian: Ez jelöli azt a helyet, ahol én, Ulf, életem harmadik nyarán Valheimben először pillantottam meg a nagy sárkányt. Itt állt meg, hogy szarvas és vaddisznó csontokat, valamint egy szürketörp koponyáját tartalmazó ürülékkupacot hagyjon maga után. Soha többé nem jövök a közelbe.
Icelandic: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Italian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Japanese: これは私、ウルフによって、Valheimで過ごす三度目の夏に初めて大いなるドレイクが目の当たりにされた場所を示すものである。 彼女はここに止まり、糞の山を残した。 その中には鹿や猪の骨、灰色ドワーフの頭蓋があった。 二度と私がこの場所に近づくことはないだろう。
Korean: 이곳은 저, 울프가 발헤임에서 세 번째 보내는 여름에 거대한 드레이크를 처음 목격한 장소입니다. 그것은 이곳에 사슴과 멧돼지의 뼈 그리고 회색 난쟁이의 두개골이 얽혀있는 배설물을 남기고 갔습니다. 저는 두 번 다시 이 근처에 오지 않을 것입니다.
Lithuanian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Macedonian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Norwegian: Dette markerer stedet hvor den mektige dragen ble først sett av meg, Ulf, i den tredje sommeren av mitt liv i Valheim. Hun stoppet her for å legge fra seg møkk som inneholdt beina til hjort, villsvin, og hodeskallen til en grådverg. Jeg skal aldri dra tilbake til dette stedet.
Polish: Ten znak wskazuje miejsce, gdzie po raz pierwszy ja, Ulf, ujrzałem wielką drakonę w trzecie lato mojego pobytu w Valheim. Zatrzymała się tutaj, by zostawić stos łajna pełnego kości jelenia, dzika i czaszki Szarła. Nigdy więcej nie zbliżę się do tego miejsca.
Portuguese: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Isto marca o local onde eu, Ulf, avistei a grande mãe draco pela primeira vez, no terceiro verão da minha vida em Valheim. Ela parou aqui e defecou um monte de esterco com ossos de veado, javali e o crânio de um anão cinzento. Nunca mais vou chegar perto deste lugar.
Romanian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Russian: Это место, где я, Ульф, впервые увидел самку дракона, третьим летом моего пребывания в Вальхейме. Она остановилась здесь, оставив после себя переваренную кучу костей оленя, кабана и череп грейдворфа. Я никогда больше не подойду к этому месту.
Serbian: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Slovak: This marks the spot where the great drake was first seen by me, Ulf, in the third summer of my life in Valheim. She stopped here to leave a pile of dung holding the bones of deer, boar and the skull of a greydwarf. I will never come near this place again.
Spanish: Aquí está el lugar en el que yo, Ulf, vi a la gran dragona por primera vez. Fue el tercer verano de mi vida en Valheim. Se detuvo a dejar una pila de basura formada por huesos de ciervo, jabalí e incluso el cráneo de un grisucio. Jamás volveré a acercarme a este lugar.
Swedish: Denna sten markerar platsen där den första draken skådades av mig, Ulf, under min tredje sommar i Valheim. Hon stannade här för att lämna en dynghög i vilken jag fann benen av en hjort, ett svin, och en Grådvärg. Jag kommer aldrig till denna plats återvända.
Thai: นี่เป็นจุดที่ฉันเห็นเจ้าเป็ดตัวใหญ่เป็นครั้งแรก Ulf ในฤดูร้อนที่สามของชีวิตที่ Valheim เธอหยุดที่นี่เพื่อทิ้งกองมูลสัตว์ที่เก็บกระดูกกวางหมูป่าและกะโหลกศีรษะของคนแคระเทา ฉันจะไม่เข้ามาใกล้สถานที่แห่งนี้อีกแล้ว
Turkish: Ben, Ulf, tam da bu noktada, Valheim'daki hayatımın üçüncü yazında ulu ejderi ilk kez burada gördüm. Burada inip, geriye geyik ve domuz kemikleri ile Bozcüce kafatası bulunan koca bir dışkı yığını bıraktı. Bir daha bu yerin yanına bile yaklaşmam.
Ukrainian: Третього літа у Вальгаймі я, Ульф, відмітив це місце, де вперше побачив велику драконицю. Вона зупинилася тут, щоби випорожнитися, і в лайні її побачив я кістки оленя й вепра, та ще череп сіролюда. Ніколи більше не наважуся наблизитися я сюди.

English: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Abenaki: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Bulgarian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Chinese: 请停下你的脚步并倾听，旅行者。 在英灵神殿最高的山峰，空气凛冽而稀薄。 在这里你有可能可以听到来自其他地方的声音，譬如人界战争的号角，瓦尔哈拉宴会的喧哗或女武神们穿梭在各个神界的哀鸣。
Croatian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Czech: Stůj a poslouchej, pocestný. Na nejvyšších vrcholcích Valheimu, vzduch je tenký a křehký. Odsud můžeš občas zachytit zvuky z míst jiných. Řinčení bitvy v Midgardu, ruch hostiny ve Valhalle nebo křik Valkýry, jak překračuje prostor mezi světy.
Danish: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Dutch: Stop, reiziger, en luister. Op de hoogste pieken van Valheim is de lucht dun en breekbaar. Je zult er soms geluiden kunnen horen die van elders komen: de strijdroep van Midgard, het gebulder van een feest in Walhalla, of de gil van een Walkure die de ruimte tussen de werelden doorkruist.
Estonian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Finnish: Seisahdu ja kuuntele, kulkija. Valheimin korkeimmilla huipuilla ilma on ohutta ja heikkoa. Tältä paikalta saatat joskus kuulla muitten seutujen kaikuja: Midgardin taistelun kalkkeen, Valhallan juhlien rymyn tai valkyrian kirkaisun tämän ylittäessä kahden maailman rajan.
French: Arrêtez-vous et écoutez, voyageur. Sur les plus hautes cimes de Valheim, l'air est rare et fragile. D'ici, vous pouvez parfois entendre les bruits de lieux éloignés, le fracas des batailles de Midgard, le rugissement d'un festin au Valhalla ou le hurlement d'une Valkyrie qui traverse l'espace entre les mondes.
Georgian: გაჩერდი და მომისმინე, მოგზაურო. ვალჰეიმის ყველაზე მაღალ ადგილებში ჰაერი მძიმეა. აქედან ხანდახან შეიძლება მოგესმეთ ხმა სხვადასხვა ადგილებიდან: ბრძოლის ხმა მიდგრადიდან, ქეიფის ხმა ვალჰალადან ან ვალკრიას ყვირილი.
German: Halte ein und höre zu, Reisender. Auf den höchsten Gipfeln Valheims ist die Luft nur sehr dünn. Von hier aus kannst du manchmal die Klänge anderer Orte vernehmen: den Schall des Kampfes von Midgard, das Gebrüll der Festgelage von Walhalla oder auch den Schrei einer Walküre, die gerade von einer in die andere Welt gelangt.
Greek: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Hindi: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Hungarian: Megállj, és fülelj, vándor! Valheim legmagasabb csúcsain a levegő ritka és múlandó. Innen néha más helyekről is hallhatsz hangokat: a midgardi csata gyűrűjét, a valhallai ünnep üvöltését vagy egy valkűr sikolyát, amikor áthalad a világok közötti téren.
Icelandic: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Italian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Japanese: 旅人よ、立ち止まり、聞け。 Valheimの最も高い頂においては空気は薄く、はかない。 ここでは、ミズガルズの戦いの響き、ヴァルハラの宴の騒ぎ、世界の間を飛び回るワルキューレの叫びなど、他の場所の音が聞こえることがある。
Korean: 멈추고 들어라, 여행자여. 발헤임의 가장 높은 봉우리에는 공기가 희박하고 깨지기 쉽습니다. 여기서는 미드가르드 전투의 울림, 발할라 잔치 소동, 세계를 날아다니는 발키리의 비명 지르는 소리가 들을 수 있습니다.
Lithuanian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Macedonian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Norwegian: Stopp og lytt, vandrer. På Valheims høyeste fjell er luften tynn og skjør. Derfra kan du noen ganger høre lyder fra andre steder, kampklangen i Midgar, festen i Valhalla eller skrikene av Valkyriene som krysser rommet mellom verdene.
Polish: Zatrzymaj się i posłuchaj, podróżniku. Na najwyższych szczytach Valheim powietrze jest rozrzedzone i słabe. Stąd czasem da się usłyszeć dźwięki pochodzące z innych zakątków – odgłosy toczącej się bitwy na Midgardzie, ryk uczty w Walhalli lub wrzask walkirii, gdy przemierza przestrzeń między światami.
Portuguese: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Pare e ouça, viajante. Nos picos mais altos de Valheim, o ar é rarefeito e frágil. Daqui, por vezes é possível ouvir sons de outros lugares, um grito de batalha em Midgard, o rugido de um banquete em Valhalla ou o guincho de uma Valquíria que cruza o espaço entre os mundos.
Romanian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Russian: Постой и прислушайся, путник. На самых высоких вершинах Вальхейма воздух тонок и хрупок. Отсюда иногда можно уловить звуки из других мест: звон битвы в Мидгарде, шум пира в Вальгалле или крик валькирии, пересекающей пространство между мирами.
Serbian: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Slovak: Halt and listen, traveller. On the highest peaks of Valheim, the air is thin and fragile. From here you can sometimes catch sounds from other places, the ring of battle on Midgard, the roar of a feast in Valhalla or the shriek of a Valkyrie as she crosses the space between the worlds.
Spanish: Detente y escucha, caminante. En las cimas más altas de Valheim, el aire es escaso y frágil. Desde aquí puedes oír los sonidos procedentes de otros lugares: el repicar de una batalla en Midgard, el clamor de un banquete en el Valhalla o el alarido de una valquiria al cruzar la franja entre los mundos.
Swedish: Stanna och lyssna, vandrare. På Valheims högsta höjder är luften tunn och karg. Härifrån kan du ibland höra ljudet från platser fjärran; stridens raseri från Midgård, sorlet av en fest från Valhalla, eller en Valkyrias skri när hon korsar intet mellan världar.
Thai: หยุดและฟังนักเดินทาง บนยอดเขาที่สูงที่สุดของ Valheim อากาศเบาบางและเปราะบาง จากที่นี่บางครั้งคุณสามารถรับฟังเสียงจากที่อื่นได้เช่นวงแหวนแห่งการต่อสู้บนมิดการ์ดเสียงคำรามของงานเลี้ยงในวัลฮัลลาหรือเสียงกรีดร้องของวาลคิรีขณะที่เธอข้ามช่องว่างระหว่างโลก
Turkish: Dur ve kulak kesil, yolgezer. Valheim'ın en yüksek tepelerinde hava ince ve kırılgandır. Buradayken bazen başka diyarlardan gelen sesler duyabilirsin. Midgard'daki bir muharebenin çarpışma seslerini, Valhalla'da verilen bir ziyafetin kahkahalarını ya da bir dünyadan diğerine geçen bir Valkür'ün haykırışlarını işitebilirsin.
Ukrainian: Зупиніться та прислухайтеся. Над найвищими вершинами Вальгайму повітря крихке й тонке. Тут можна почути звуки з інших місць: відлуння битв Мідґарду, шум бенкетів у Вальгаллі або крики валькірій, коли вони перетинають порожній простір між світами.

English: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Abenaki: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Bulgarian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Chinese: 我曾在这里看到了正在盘旋的霜龙，我躲进了草丛直到她飞离了这里。 无畏者乌尔夫雕刻了这块石碑。
Croatian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Czech: Zde jsem kdysi viděl velkou dračici nade mnou proletět a schoval jsem se v keři, dokud se neztratila. Ulf Statečný tesal do tohoto kamene.
Danish: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Dutch: Op deze plek zag ik eens een grootse draak overvliegen, en verstopte ik me in de struiken tot ze me voorbij was. Deze steen is gekerfd door Ulf de Dappere.
Estonian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Finnish: Tämän kiven paikalla näin kerran suuren käärmeen lentävän ylläni, joten piilouduin puskaan kunnes se oli mennyt ohi. Ulf Urhea kaiversi tämän kiven.
French: De là, j'ai un jour vu la grande Drac me survoler et je me suis caché dans un buisson jusqu'à ce qu'elle s'en aille. Ulf le brave a gravé cette pierre.
Georgian: იქ სადაც ეს დგას, ერთხელ დრაკონი დავინახე რომელიც ჩემს მაღლა დაფრინავდა, ბუჩქში დავიმალე სანამ გაფრინდებოდა. ეს ულფმა მამაცმა დაწერა.
German: Der Ort, an dem dies steht, sah einst einen großen Drachen, der über mir schwebte - ich versteckte mich in einem Busch, bis er mich passiert hatte. Dieser Stein wurde von Ulf dem Mutigen gemeißelt.
Greek: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Hindi: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Hungarian: Ahol ez áll, egyszer láttam egy hatalmas sárkány elrepülni felettem, és elbújtam egy bokorban, amíg nem távozott. Ulf, a bátor faragta ezt a követ.
Icelandic: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Italian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Japanese: これが立つ場所で、私は一度、大いなるドレイクが頭上を飛ぶのを見、彼女が去るまで茂みに隠れていた。 勇敢なるウルフがこの石に刻む。
Korean: 예전에 이 돌이 서있는 자리에서 거대한 드레이크가 머리 위로 날아가는 것을 보았고 지나갈 때까지 덤불 속에 숨어있었어. 이 돌은 용감한 울프가 조각한 거야.
Lithuanian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Macedonian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Norwegian: Der jeg nå står så jeg en gang den mektige dragen fly over meg og gjemte meg i en busk til hun passerte. Ulf den Modige skrev denne meldingen.
Polish: Tam, gdzie stoi kamień, widziałem kiedyś wielką drakonę lecącą nade mną i ukryłem się w krzakach, dopóki mnie nie minęła. Ulf Odważny wyrył na tym kamieniu.
Portuguese: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Neste local eu vi a grande mãe draco voando sobre mim e me escondi em um arbusto até ela passar. Ulf, o Bravo, esculpiu esta pedra.
Romanian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Russian: В этом месте я однажды увидел летящего надо мной огромного дракона. Тогда я спрятался в кустах, пока он не скрылся. Ульф Храбрый вырезал этот камень.
Serbian: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Slovak: Where this stands I once saw the great drake flying above me and I hid in a bush until she passed. Ulf the Brave carved this stone.
Spanish: Una vez, donde está esta piedra, vi a la gran dragona sobrevolar este mismo lugar y tuve que esconderme en un arbusto hasta que se fue. Ulf el Audaz grabó esta piedra.
Swedish: Där denna sten står såg jag en gång den stora draken ovan mig flyga, och gömde mig i en buske tills hon ej i fjärran syntes. Ulf den Modige reste denna sten.
Thai: ที่ที่ยืนนี้ฉันเคยเห็นเป็ดตัวใหญ่บินอยู่เหนือฉันและฉันซ่อนตัวอยู่ในพุ่มไม้จนกว่าเธอจะเดินผ่านไป Ulf the Brave แกะสลักหินก้อนนี้
Turkish: Burada bir keresinde tepemde uçan bir ulu ejder görmüş ve gözden kaybolana kadar çalılarda saklanmıştım. Bu taşı Cesur Ulf oydu.
Ukrainian: Одного разу тут я побачив велику драконицю. Вона летіла просто наді мною, тож я сховався у кущах, допоки вона не полетіла геть. Ульф Хоробрий різьбив цей камінь.

English: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Abenaki: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Bulgarian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Chinese: 让我告诉你，不要在这里停留，你已经离开安全范围很远很远了。 山里面的野兽凶残而狂暴，对新鲜的肉非常饥渴，比这些野兽更糟糕的是凛冽的寒风。 穿上厚实的护甲，升起篝火并保证不要打扰到霜龙的蛋，如果你还想活命的话。
Croatian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Czech: Nechť ti, kdož čtou mne vědí, aby se nezdržovali na těchto svazích, daleko od jejich ohně a bezpečí zeleně. Bestie z hor jsou podlá a zuřivá, hladová s chutí k masu a nejhorší z těchto bestií je vítr sám. Noste tlusté kožešiny, stavte silná ohniště a buďte si jisti, abyste nevyrušili vajíčka velké dračice, pokud si života ceníte.
Danish: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Dutch: Laat degene die mij leest weten dat je op deze heuvels niet moet rusten, verre van je haard en de veiligheid van het groene bos. De beesten in deze bergen zijn wreed en ongenadig, en hongeren naar vlees; het ergste beest is de koude wind zelf. Draag dikke vachten, bouw stevige vuren, en zorg dat je de eieren van de grootse draak niet verstoord als je leven je lief is.
Estonian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Finnish: Älköön tämän kiven lukevat viivytelkö näillä rinteillä, kaukana lieden lämmöstä ja lehtimetsän turvasta. Vuorten pedot ovat vaarallisia, hurjia ja lihanhimoisia. Pahin pedoista on kuitenkin tuuli itse. Pue yllesi paksut turkit ja tee suuret nuotiot, mutta varo, ettet häiritse suuren käärmeen munia, jos henkesi on sinulle kallis.
French: Que ceux qui me lisent apprennent à ne pas lambiner sur ces versants, loin de leur foyer et de la sécurité des bois. Les bêtes de la montagne sont féroces, assoiffées de sang et il y a pire encore que ces créatures : le vent glacial. Portez d'épaisses fourrures, allumez de grands feux et ne dérangez sous aucun prétexte les œufs de la grande Drac si vous tenez à la vie.
Georgian: ყველას, ვინც ამ სიტყვებს კითხულობს, დაე იცოდნენ, რომ არ ღირს გაჩერება ამ ადგილებში, შორს სახლისგან და უსაფრთხო ტყისაგან. მთის მონსტრები ველურები არიან და ხორცის ეძებენ, და ყველაზე საშინელი კი ცივი ქარია თვითონ. თბილად ჩაიცვით, ძლიერი ცეცხლი დაანთეთ და გახსოვდეთ რომ არ შეაწუხოთ დრაკოები რომლებიც კვერცხებს იცავენ, თუ რა თქმა უნდა სისცხლე ისევ გსურთ.
German: Mögen jene, die dies lesen, an diesen Hügeln nicht lange verweilen - denn sie sind weit von der Sicherheit ihres Heims der grünen Wälder entfernt. Die Bestien der Berge sind tödlich und wild. Und sie hungern nach Fleisch. Doch die gefährlichste dieser Bestien ist der kalte Wind selbst. Möge ein jeder dicke Felle tragen, mächtige Feuer entfachen und sicherstellen, dass er nicht die Eier der großen Drachen stört … falls ihm sein Leben etwas bedeutet.
Greek: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Hindi: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Hungarian: Azok, akik ezt olvassák, szerezzenek tudomást róla, hogy ne időzzenek ezeken a lejtőkön, messze a kandallójuk és a zöld rengeteg biztonságától! A hegyvidék fenevadjai könyörtelenek és vadak, húsra éheznek, és a legrosszabb közülük maga a hideg szél. Viselj vastag szőrmét, építs erős tüzeket, és ügyelj arra, hogy meg ne zavard a nagy sárkány tojásait, ha kedves az életed!
Icelandic: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Italian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Japanese: 我を読むものは心して、家の炉から、安全なる緑の森から離れたこの峰に、長くとどまるべからざることを知るべし。 山中の獣は気が荒く獰猛で肉に飢えている。 しかし最悪の獣は冷たい風それ自体である。 厚い毛皮を身にまとい、赤々と火を燃やし、命を大事と思うなら、ゆめ大いなるドレイクの卵に手を出すべからず。
Korean: 이 글을 읽는 자는 화로와 안전한 녹색 숲에서 멀리 떨어진 이 봉우리에 오래 머물지 말아야 할 것이다. 산중의 짐승은 성질이 사납고 사나워 고기에 굶주려 있다. 그러나 최악의 짐승은 찬바람 그 자체다. 두꺼운 털 가죽을 입고 새빨갛게 불을 지피고 목숨을 생각한다면 드레이크 알에 손을 대지 말 것.
Lithuanian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Macedonian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Norwegian: La de som leser dette ikke forbli i fjellene for lenge, langt fra varmen og tryggheten til skogen. Fjellenes beist er farlige og sultne etter kjøtt, og det farligste beistet er vinden selv. Kle deg i tykk pels, bygg sterke bål og sørg for å ikke forstyrre eggene til den mektige dragen hvis du verdsetter livet.
Polish: Niech czytelnicy wiedzą, żeby nie pozostawać na tych stokach, z dala od ogniska i schronienia liściastych lasów. Górskie bestie są dzikie i srogie, spragnione mięsa, a najgorszym z nich jest sam lodowaty wiatr. Noś grube futra, rozpalaj mocne ogniska i pamiętaj, by nie ruszać jaj wielkiej drakony, jeśli życie ci miłe.
Portuguese: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Aos que leem, não se demorem nestas encostas, longe do lar e da segurança da floresta. Os animais das montanhas são cruéis e ferozes, famintos por carne, mas o pior deles é o próprio vento gélido. Vista peles grossas, monte fogueiras fortes e sob hipótese alguma perturbe os ovos da grande mãe draco, se é que você tem amor à vida.
Romanian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Russian: Все, кто читает мои слова, знайте, что не стоит задерживаться на этих склонах, вдали от очага и безопасного леса. Звери в горах свирепые и дикие, они жаждут плоти. Но хуже зверей может быть только холодный ветер. Носите теплые меха, разводите большие костры и не трогайте яйца великих драконов, если дорожите своей жизнью.
Serbian: Let those who read me know not to tarry on these slopes, far from their hearth and the safety of the greenwood. The beasts of the mountains are fell and fierce, hungry for meat, and the worst of these beasts is the cold wind itself. Wear thick furs, build strong fires and be sure not to disturb the eggs of the great drake if you value your life.
Slovak: Nech tí, ktorí ma čítajú, vedia, aby sa nezdržiavali na týchto svahoch, ďaleko od svojho ohniska a bezpečia lesa. Beštie z hôr sú podlé a zúrivé, hladné po mäse a najhorší z nich je samotný mrazivý vietor. Noste hrubé kožušiny, udržujte silné ohne a určite nerušte vajcia veľkej dračice, ak je vám život milý.
Spanish: Que todos quienes me lean no se entretengan en estas laderas, pues se encuentran lejos del hogar y de la protección del bosque. Las bestias de estas montañas son tan siniestras como feroces y hambrientas de carne. El peor de todas ellas es el viento gélido. Poneos pieles gruesas, encended hogueras y jamás molestéis a los huevos de la gran dragona si valoráis vuestras vidas.
Swedish: Låt den som mig läsa veta väl att på dessa höjder ej dröja; fjärran från hemmets härd och skogens trygga grönska. Odjuren i bergen är våldsamma och vildsinta, och värst av alla odjur är vinden själv. Bär tjocka hudar, bygg rasande eldar, och om du har livet kärt, vet att ej störa den stora drakens ägg.
Thai: ขอให้ผู้ที่อ่านฉันรู้ว่าอย่าอยู่บนเนินเหล่านี้ห่างไกลจากเตาไฟและความปลอดภัยของกรีนวู้ด สัตว์ป่าจากภูเขาล้มลงและดุร้ายหิวโหยและหิวโหยสัตว์ร้ายที่สุดก็คือลมหนาวนั่นเอง สวมเสื้อขนสัตว์หนาสร้างกองไฟที่แข็งแกร่งและอย่ารบกวนไข่ของเป็ดตัวใหญ่หากคุณให้ความสำคัญกับชีวิตของคุณ
Turkish: Bunu okuyanlar, evlerinin sıcağından ve çayırların güvenli alanlarından çok uzaktaki bu bayırlarda dolanmamaları gerektiğini bilsinler. Bu dağlarda kol gezen vahşi ve insafsız yaratıklar ete açtır ve bu yaratıklardan kötüsü de ayazın ta kendisidir. Canına değer veriyorsan kalın kürkünü giy, dayanıklı ateşler inşa et ve ulu ejderin yumurtalarına ilişme.
Ukrainian: Нехай ті, хто читають це, знають, що не варто затримуватися на цих схилах, так далеко від своїх вогнищ і безпеки зелених лісів. У горах живуть звірі люті й голодні, а найгірший із них — холодний вітер. Користуйтеся одягом із товстого хутра, розводьте великі багаття й у жодному разі не чіпайте яєць великої дракониці, якщо цінуєте власне життя.

English:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Abenaki:
Nia, Astrid, nd'liponemen ni sen almiwi tôbawôz kassigadek Valheimek. Tojiwi u tali na Wmitôgwes mziwi n'klologw. Wji tokinôna angitta n'meskamenal w'klozowôganal wiwini niak wskijiwi akik, chidanaskadek senikok. Niga ni adoji n'kezabzemenal nd'eljikok ni atali zogbasok waji kizi hlihidit Wmitôgwes kagui chowaldak papazgwen.

Kizahlô Pagitowinnoijik. Klabido w'dupwôga. Nawaji.
Bulgarian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Chinese:
这块石碑是被我来英灵神殿的第七年放在这里的，我是阿斯特丽德。 诸神之父曾在这里和我对话。 我从长眠中醒来，发现留给我的话散落在我周围的地面上，已经被冻得像鹅卵石。 当我用的双手捧起它们，它们开始融化并一字一句地对我说出了奥丁留给我的话。 


击杀被遗忘者们，用锁链绑起他们的头颅，我便会出现。
Croatian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Czech:
Tento kámen jsem položila já, Astrid, během mého sedmého roku ve Valheimu. A na tomto místě, Otec Veškerenstva ke mne promluvil. Probudila jsem se z hlubokého spánku a našla jsem jeho slova rozptýlena po zemi, zamrzlá v led hlubokou zimou. Když jsem je zahřála v mých rukou, roztála a promluvila svou zprávou ke mne. Slovo po slovu.

Vyhub Zatracené. Jejich hlavy na řetězy přivaž. Pak já přijdu.
Danish:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Dutch:
Deze steen is hier geplaatst door mij, Astrid, in mijn zevende jaar in Valheim. Op deze plek sprak de Alvader tot mij. Ik werd wakker uit een diepe slaap en vond zijn woorden rond me op de grond, bevroren tot kiezels door de diepe kou. Toen ik ze verwarmde met mijn handen ontdooiden ze en ze gaven me dit bericht, woord voor woord.

Versla de Verlatenen. Keten hun hoofden. Dan kom ik.
Estonian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Finnish:
Tämän kiven pystytin minä, Astrid, seitsemäntenä vuotenani Valheimissa. Tällä paikalla Odin puhui minulle. Heräsin syvästä unesta ja löysin hänen sanansa maasta levällään, pakkasen pieniksi kiviksi jäädyttäminä. Kun lämmitin noita kiviä käsissäni, ne sulivat ja kertoivat minulle viestinsä sana kerrallaan.

Tapa Hyljätyt. Kahlitse heidän päänsä. Minä tulen.
French:
Moi, Astrid, ai laissé cette pierre ici lors de ma septième année sur Valheim. C'est à cet endroit que le Père de Toute Chose m'a parlé. J'ai été tirée d'un profond sommeil par ses mots, éparpillés autour de moi sur le sol, emprisonnés dans la glace par le froid mordant. Quand je les ai réchauffés entre mes mains, ils ont fondu et m'ont transmis son message, un mot après l'autre.

Triomphez des Déchus. Enchaînez leurs têtes. Je viendrai.
Georgian:
ეს ქვა მე დავდე, ასტრიდმა, ჩემი ცხოვრების მეშვიდე წელს ვალჰეიმში. აქ მამაღმერთი გამომელაპარაკა. გავიღვიძე და შევამჩნიე, რომ მისი სიტყვები ყინულის ლოლოებად გადაიქცნენ ამ სიცივისაგან და ჩემ გარშემო იყო მიმოფანტული. როცა ისნი გავათვე ჩემი ხელებით, ისინი დადნენ და სიტყვა სიტყვით გადმომცეს ოდინის ნათვამი.

მოკალი დაცემულებუ. მოკვეთე მათ თავები. შემომწირე ისინი და მე მოვალ!
German:
Dieser Stein wurde von mir, Astrid, hier platziert, während meines siebenten Jahres in Valheim. An einem Ort, an dem der Allvater selbst zu mir sprach. Ich erwachte aus einem tiefen Schlummer, nur um seine Worte um mich herum zu finden - auf dem Boden verstreut und aufgrund der Kälte zu Kieseln erfroren. Als ich sie in meiner Hand erwärmte, tauten sie auf, wodurch ich seine Botschaft vernahm. Ein Wort nach dem anderen.

Töte die Wächter. Lege ihre Köpfe an die Kette. Ich werde kommen.
Greek:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.

Hungarian:
Ezt a követ én, Astrid helyeztem el a Valheimben töltött hetedik évemben. Ezen a helyen szólt hozzám a Mindenatya. Egy mély álomból ébredtem, hogy megtaláljam a szavait szétszórva körülöttem a földön, kavicsokba fagyva a nagy hidegtől. Amikor a kezemben megmelengettem őket felolvadtak, és egyik szó a másik után adta át nekem az üzenetét.

Öld meg az elhagyottakat! Láncold meg a fejüket! Én el fogok jönni.
Icelandic:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Italian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Japanese:
この石は、Valheimに住みて七年目、私、アストリッドによって置かれたものである。 ここで最高神より言葉をたまわった。 深い眠りより目覚めると、まわりの地面に神の言葉が深い寒さによって凍りつき、小石となって散らばっていた。 それを手で温めると、その言葉は溶け出し、ひとつひとつ、神の伝言となって語られた。 

見捨てられしものを倒せ。 その頭に鎖をかけよ。 我は来たる。
Korean:
이 돌은 발헤임에 산 지 7년째 되는 해에 아스트리드에 의해 놓여진 것이다. 이 지점에서 최고신이 내게 말했다. 깊은 잠에서 깨어나 땅에 흩어져있는 그의 말을 발견하고, 깊은 추위에 자갈로 얼어붙었다. 그것을 손으로 따뜻하게 하면, 그 말은 녹아내리고 하나하나 신의 전언이 되어 이야기되었다.

버려진 물건을 쓰러뜨려라. 그 머리에 쇠사슬을 걸어라. 나는 돌아온다.
Lithuanian:

I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Macedonian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Norwegian:
Denne steinen ble satt her av meg, Astrid, i mitt syvende år i Valheim. På dette stedet snakket Allfaderen til meg. Jeg våknet fra en dyp søvn for å finne hans ord strødt rundt meg på bakken, frosne og harde. Da jeg varmet dem i hendene mine gav de meg sine meldinger, ord etter ord.

Ødelegg De Fortapte. Legg hodene deres i lenker. Jeg kommer.
Polish:
Ten kamień został umieszczony przeze mnie, Astrid, w siódmym roku mojego pobytu w Valheim. W tym miejscu przemówił do mnie Wszechojciec. Obudziłam się z głębokiego snu i zobaczyłam jego słowa rozrzucone wokół mnie na ziemi w postaci zamarzniętych kamyków. Kiedy ogrzałam je w dłoniach, rozmroziły się i przekazały mi jego przesłanie – słowo po słowie.

Zabij Wygnanych. Przywiąż do siebie ich głowy. A ja przybędę.
Portuguese:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Portuguese_Brazilian:
Esta pedra foi colocada por mim, Astrid, no meu sétimo ano em Valheim. Neste local, o Pai de Todos falou comigo. Acordei de um sono profundo e encontrei as palavras dele espalhadas no chão ao redor, como pedras congeladas pelo frio profundo. Quando as aqueci em minhas mãos, elas descongelaram e entregaram sua mensagem, palavra por palavra.

Mate os Guardiões. Acorrente suas cabeças. Eu virei.
Romanian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Russian:
Этот камень заложила я, Астрид, на седьмом году жизни в Вальхейме. Здесь со мной заговорил Всеотец. Я пробудилась ото сна и обнаружила, что его слова превратились в льдинки от сильного холода и рассыпались по земле вокруг меня. Когда я согрела их в руках, они оттаяли и передали мне его послание, слово за словом.

Убей павших. Отруби им головы. Принеси их на алтарь. И я приду.
Serbian:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Slovak:
This stone was placed by me, Astrid, in my seventh year in Valheim. At this spot, the Allfather spoke to me. I awoke from a deep sleep to find his words scattered around me on the ground, frozen to pebbles by the deep cold. When I warmed them in my hands they thawed and spoke his message to me, one word after another.

Slay the Forsaken. Chain their heads. I will come.
Spanish:
Esta piedra la coloqué yo, Astrid, durante mi séptimo año en Valheim. El Padre Todopoderoso me habló en este lugar. Cuando me desperté de un sueño profundo, sus palabras se encontraban en el suelo, congeladas a causa del frío, a mi alrededor. Las cogí entre mis manos para que entraran en calor, y al derretirse me dieron el mensaje, palabra tras palabra.

"Acaba con los Desterrados". "Encadénales las cabezas". "Acudiré".
Swedish:
Denna sten restes av mig, Astrid, under mitt sjunde år i Valheim. På denna plats talte Allfadern till mig. Från djup sömn vaknade jag att finna hans ord runt mig spridda, som småsten frusen på marken. Jag tinade dem i handen, och de talte till mig hans meddelande, ord för ord.

Dräp de Bannlysta. Häng deras huvuden. Jag skall komma.
Thai:
ข้าแอสทริด ข้าคือผู้ที่วางหินก้อนนี้เอาไว้ ในปีที่เจ็ดของข้าในวัลไฮม์ บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งได้พูดคุยกับข้าที่นี่ ข้าตื่นขึ้นมาจากการหลับใหล และพบคำพูดของเขาที่แข็งตัวเป็นเหมือนก้อนกรวดกระจัดกระจายอยู่รอบตัวข้า ข้าถือคำพูดเหล่านี้เอาไว้ในมือของข้า ไม่นานนักมันก็ละลาย และกลายเป็นเสียงพูดออกมาทีละคำ

"สังหารผู้ที่ถูกเนรเทศ ตัดหัวของพวกเขา แล้วข้าจะไปหา"
Turkish:
Bu taş, Valheim'daki yedinci yılımda ben, yani Astrid tarafından yapıldı. Tam burada, Tanrıbaba benimle konuştu. Derin bir uykudan uyandığımda Tanrıbaba'nın kelamını etrafımdaki toprağa dağılmış, derin soğukla donmuş çakıllarda buldum. Çakılları elimde ısıttığımda, bana Tanrıbaba'nın kelamını bir bir ilettiler.

Yitikler'i alt et. Başlarını zincirle. Geleceğim.
Ukrainian:
На сьомому році мого перебування у Вальгаймі я, Астрід, поставила цей камінь. На цьому місці Всебатько говорив зі мною. Я прокинулася від глибокого сну та знайшла його слова, розкидані довкола мене, примерзлі до землі від лютого холоду. Від тепла моїх рук вони розтанули й передали його послання, слово за словом.
 
«Знищ Забутих. Підвісь їхні голови. Я прийду».
