Serbian: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Slovak: Sheathe your pride, creature of Odin! My long reign is at an end but those who come after me are greater still...
Spanish: ¡Enfunda ese orgullo tuyo, criatura de Odín! Puede que mi reinado llegue a su fin, pero mis predecesores son aún más poderosos...
Swedish: Mantla din stolthet, du Odens kreatur. Mitt välde må ha tagit slut, men jag kommer ersättas av större, fruktansvärdare...
Thai: อย่าโอหังให้มากนักเจ้าสิ่งมีชีวิตของโอดิน! แม้ว่าการครองบัลลังก์อันยาวนานของข้าจะสิ้นสุดลง แต่ผู้ที่สืบทอดต่อจากข้าจะยิ่งแข็งแกร่ง...
Turkish: Odin'in yarattığı, kibirden sakın! Kadim saltanatım sonuna yaklaşıyor ama ardımdan gelenler daha da haşmetli olacak...
Ukrainian: Зменш пиху, Одінове творіння! Моє довге правління добігло кінця, але ті, хто прийдуть після мене, будуть величніші…

English: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Abenaki: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Bulgarian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Chinese: 小东西，你是来嘲笑我的吗？你知道我已经被杀戮，撕裂，放逐，焚烧，掩埋过多少次了吗？你不是第一个这样做的人，也不会是最后一个。
Croatian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Czech: Přišel jsi se pokochat, drobečku? Víš, kolikrát jsem byl zabit, zlomen, vykázán, spálen a pohřben? Nejsi první a nebudeš ani poslední.
Danish: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Dutch: Kom je je verkneukelen, klein ding? Weet je wel hoe vaak ik ben gedood, gebroken, verbannen, verbrand, en begraven? Jij bent noch de eerste, noch zul je de laatste zijn.
Estonian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Finnish: Tulitko ylpeilemään, pieni olento? Tiedätkö kuinka monta kertaa minut on tapettu, rikottu, karkoitettu, poltettu ja haudattu? Sinä et ole ensimmäinen etkä tule olemaan viimeinen.
French: Vous venez vous gausser, petite chose ? Savez-vous combien de fois j'ai été tué, brisé, banni, brûlé et enterré ? Ce ne sera pas la première fois ni la dernière.
Georgian: მოხვედი შე უბედურო არსებავ? იცი რამდენჯერ მოვუკლვარ, დავუმტვრევივარ, დავუწვივარ და დავუმარხივარ? შენ არც პირველი და არც უკანასკნელი იქნები.
German: Bist du hier, um anzugeben? Weißt du nicht, wie oft ich bereits getötet und gebrochen, verbannt und verbrannt und auch begraben wurde? Du bist nicht die erste und wirst auch nicht die letzte Person sein.
Greek: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Hindi: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Hungarian: Azért jöttél, hogy kárörvendj, kicsiny lény? Tudod, hányszor öltek és törtek meg, száműztek, égettek és temettek el? Nem te vagy az első, és nem is te leszel az utolsó.
Icelandic: Kemur þú með derring, litla vera? Veist þú hversu oft ég hef verið drepinn, brotin í bita, hrakin, brenndur, og jarðaður? Þú ert ekki sá fyrsti og mun ekki vera sá síðasti.
Italian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Japanese: ちっぽけな者よ、これで満足か？私がどれほど何度も殺され、滅ぼされ、消され、焼かれ、埋められたか知っているか？おまえは最初ではないし、最後でもない。
Korean: 꼬마야, 나를 비웃으러 왔니? 내가 몇 번이나 죽고, 부서지고, 추방되고, 불타고, 묻혔는지 아니? 너는 처음도 아니고 마지막도 아니야.
Lithuanian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Macedonian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Norwegian: Har du kommet for å gløtte, lille greie? Vet du hvor mange ganger jeg har blitt drept, knust, bannlyst, brent og begravet? Du er ikke den første og blir ikke den siste.
Polish: Przybywasz, by zatriumfować, chuchro? Czy wiesz, ile razy zostałem zabity, pokonany, wygnany, spalony i pochowany? Nie jesteś pierwszy i nie będziesz ostatni.
Portuguese: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você vem para se gabar, coisa diminuta? Sabe quantas vezes já fui morto, quebrado, banido, queimado e enterrado? Você não foi o primeiro e nem será o último.
Romanian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Russian: Собираешься позлорадствовать, ничтожество? Знаешь, сколько раз меня убивали, ломали, изгоняли, сжигали и хоронили? Много их было до тебя, много будет и после.
Serbian: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Slovak: Do you come to gloat, little thing? Do you know how many times I have been killed, broken, banished, burned and buried? You are not the first and you will not be the last.
Spanish: ¿Vienes a regodearte, criatura? ¿Sabes cuántas veces me han matado, destrozado, desterrado, quemado y enterrado? No eres la primera persona... ni serás la última.
Swedish: Har du kommit för att stilla din skadeglädje, du lille? Vet du hur många gånger jag blivit dödad, knäckt, bannlyst, bränd och begraven? Du är inte först, och du kommer inte bli sist.
Thai: เจ้ามาเพื่อหัวเราะเยาะข้าเหรอไง? รู้ไหมว่ากี่ครั้งแล้วที่ข้าถูกสังหาร ถูกทำลาย ถูกเนรเทศ ถูกเผา และถูกฝัง? เจ้าไม่ใช่คนแรกที่ทำสิ่งนี้ และจะไม่ใช่คนสุดท้ายด้วย
Turkish: Böbürlenmeye mi geldin, küçük şey? Kaç sefer öldürüldüğümü, parçalandığımı, sürgün edildiğimi, yakıldığımı ve gömüldüğümü biliyor musun? İlk değilsin, son da olmayacaksın.
Ukrainian: Будеш вихвалятися, маленька істото? Знаєш, скільки разів мене вбивали, ламали, виганяли, спалювали й закопували? Не з тебе це почалося і не на тобі це скінчиться.

English: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Abenaki: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Bulgarian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Chinese: Kraa！幸会，流浪者...我是雾尼，福金的弟弟。 我代奥丁与你见面。 他可以看到我眼里看到的一切，我可以带他说出他想要说的话。 遵循他的旨意，我便会再回到你身边...
Croatian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Czech: Krá! Budíž pozdraven, pocestný... Já jsem Munin, bratr Huginův. Přináším pozdravy od Otce Veškerenstva. Jeho oči vidí vše, co mé. Nesu jeho slova pod svým jazykem. Drž se jeho cest a opět se setkáme…
Danish: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Dutch: Kraa! Gegroet, reiziger... Ik ben Munin, de broer van Hugin. De Alvader groet je. Zijn oog ziet door de mijne, en ik draag op mijn tong zijn woorden met mij mee. Leef in navolging van zijn wil, dan kom ik je later weer bezoeken...
Estonian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Finnish: Kraa! Tervehdys, kulkija. Olen Munin, Huginin veli. Tuon tervehdyksen kaikkien olentojen isältä. Hän näkee silmilläni ja kannan suussani hänen sanaansa. Elä hänen tahtonsa mukaan, niin tulen luoksesi vielä uudestaan…
French: Croââ ! Salutations, voyageur... Je suis Munin, le frère de Hugin. Le Père de Toute Chose vous salue. Mes yeux sont le sien, ma langue porte ses mots. Continuez à lui obéir et il reviendra vers vous...
Georgian: კრაა! მე მუნინი ვარ, ჰუგინის ძმა. მოგესალმები ოდინის სახელით. მე მისი თვალები და ენა ვარ. უსმინე მას და მე ისევ მოვალ შენთან...
German: Krah! So treffen wir uns wieder, Wanderer. Ich bin Munin, der Bruder von Hugin. Ich komme mit Grüßen vom Allvater. Sein Auge sieht durch die meinen. Und ich trage seine Worte auf der Zunge in meinem Schnabel. Handle, wie er es verlangt, und ich werde dich erneut aufsuchen.
Greek: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Hindi: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Hungarian: Kááár! Örvendek a találkozásnak, vándor... Munin vagyok, Hugin testvére. A Mindenatya üdvözletét hoztam magammal. A szeme az enyémen át figyel, a szavait az én nyelvem alatt hordozom. Teljesítsd az akaratát, és később újra meg foglak látogatni...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Vel gert, ferðalangi... Ég er Muninn, bróðir Hugins. Ég skila þér kveðju frá Alföður. Auga hans sér þig úr mínum augum, ég ber orð hans fram undan tungu minnar. Haltu þér í skefjum Alföðurs og við hittumst aftur...
Italian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Japanese: クワァァ！よいところで会った、さすらい人よ... 我はムニン、フギンの弟だ。 最高神よりの挨拶を届ける。 この目を通して彼は見、この舌を通して彼の言葉は運ばれる。 彼の道を外さぬならば、また会うことになろう...
Korean: 까악! 안녕 방랑자... 나는 무닌이라고 해, 후긴과는 형제사이야. 최고신께서 안부 인사를 보내셨어. 그분계서는 나의 눈을 통해 보시고, 나의 혀는 그분의 말씀을 전하지. 네가 그분의 뜻을 계속 따른다면 널 다시 만나러 올게...
Lithuanian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Macedonian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Norwegian: Kraa! Vel møtt, vandrer... Jeg er Munin, bror til Hugin. Jeg bringer hilsener fra Allfaderen. Hans øye ser gjennom mine, jeg bærer hans ord på tungen. Hold deg til hans veier og jeg vil besøke deg igjen snart...
Polish: Kraa! Witaj, wędrowcze… Jestem Munin, brat Hugina. Przynoszę pozdrowienia od Wszechojca. Jego spojrzenie przenika przeze mnie, a jego słowa przemawiają z mych ust. Podążaj jego drogą, a ja znów cię odwiedzę…
Portuguese: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Muito bem, viajante… Sou Munin, irmão de Hugin. Trago saudações do Pai de Todos. O olho dele vê através do meu, eu carrego as palavras sob a minha língua. Siga a vontade dele e eu voltarei para você…
Romanian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Russian: Крра! Рад встрече, странник... Я Мунин, брат Хугина. Передаю приветствие от Всеотца. Я — его глаза и его уста. Слушайся его, и я снова приду к тебе...
Serbian: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Slovak: Kraa! Well met, wanderer… I am Munin, brother to Hugin. I bring greetings from the Allfather. His eye sees through mine, I carry his words beneath my tongue. Keep his ways and I will come to you again…
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Dichosos los ojos, caminante. Soy Munin, el hermano de Hugin. Traigo saludos del Padre Todopoderoso. Ve a través de mis ojos y llevo sus palabras bajo la lengua. Sigue su camino y volveré a dar contigo...
Swedish: Krax! Väl mött, krigare… Jag är Munin, broder till Hugin. Jag bär Allfaderns hälsningar. Hans öga ser genom mina, hans ord bär jag under min tunga. Var hans vägar sanna, så återvänder jag…
Thai: กา กา! ยินดีที่ได้พบคนหลงทาง… ข้าคือมูนินพี่น้องของฮูกิ้น บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งฝากทักทายเจ้า เขามองผ่านดวงตาคู่นี้ของข้า และคำพูดของเขาถูกถ่ายทอดผ่านลิ้นของข้า ทำตามความต้องการของเขา แล้วข้าจะกลับมาหาเจ้า…
Turkish: Gaak! Tanıştığımıza sevindim yolgezer... Benim adım Munin, Hugin'in kardeşiyim. Tanrıbaba'nın selamlarını getirdim. Tanrıbaba benim gözümden görür, kelamını dilimde taşırım. Tanrıbaba'nın yolundan sapmazsan seninle tekrar görüşeceğiz…
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Вітаю, людино… Я — Мунін, брат Хуґіна. Тобі Всебатько вітання передає. Його око дивиться крізь моє, мій язик вимовляє його слова. Тримайся його вказівок, і я знову навідаюся до тебе…

English: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Abenaki: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Bulgarian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Chinese: Kraa！所有的眼睛都在这里。 大眼睛，小眼睛，天之眼和地之眼。 甚至树木也有眼睛...
Croatian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Czech: Krá! Všechny oči sledují tohoto. Velké oči, malé oči. Oči shůry a oči z hlubin. I stromy mají oči…
Danish: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Dutch: Kraa! Alle ogen zijn op je gericht. Grote ogen, kleine ogen, ogen vanboven en ogen vanonder. Zelfs de bomen hebben ogen...
Estonian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Finnish: Kraa! Kaikki silmät tarkkailevat sinua. Suuret silmät, pienet silmät, silmät korkeuksissa ja silmät syvyyksissä. Jopa puilla on silmät…
French: Croââ ! Tous les yeux se tournent vers vous. De grands yeux, des petits, du ciel et de la terre. Même les arbres ont des yeux...
Georgian: კრაა! ყველას მზერა შენზეა მოპყრობილი. დიდი თვალები და პატარა თვალები, თვალები ზევიდა და თვალები ქვევიდა. ხეებსაც კი აქვს თვალები…
German: Krah! Alle Augen sind auf diesen Helden gerichtet. Große Augen, kleine Augen, Augen von oben und Augen von unten. Sogar die Bäume haben Augen …
Greek: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Hindi: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Hungarian: Káár! Minden szem erre a példányra figyel. Nagy szemek, kis szemek, szemek fentről és szemek alulról. Még a fáknak is vannak szemeik...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Öll augu beina að þessum. Stór augu, lítil auga, auga að ofan, og augu að neðan. Jafnvel trén hafa augu...
Italian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Japanese: クワァァ！すべての目がこの者を見る。 大きな目、小さな目、上からの目、下からの目。 木々にも目はあるのだぞ...
Korean: 까악! 모든 눈이 이 자를 보고 있어. 큰 눈, 작은 눈, 위쪽 눈, 아래쪽 눈. 그리고 나무에도 눈이 있데...
Lithuanian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Macedonian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Norwegian: Kraa! Alle øyne legges på denne. Store øyne, små øyne, øyne fra oven og øyne fra under. Også trærne har øyne...
Polish: Kraa! Tylko spójrzcie na to. Duże oczy i małe, oczy z góry i oczy z dołu. Nawet drzewa je mają…
Portuguese: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Todos os olhos estão voltados para este. Olhos grandes, olhos pequenos, olhos de cima e olhos de baixo. Até as árvores têm olhos…
Romanian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Russian: Крра! Все взоры прикованы к тебе. Большие глаза и маленькие глазки, глаза сверху и глаза снизу. Даже у деревьев есть глаза...
Serbian: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Slovak: Kraa! All eyes are on this one. Big eyes, little eyes, eyes from above and eyes from below. Even the trees have eyes…
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Todos los ojos miran a esta persona. Ojos grandes, pequeños, los que vienen de arriba, de abajo... Hasta los árboles tienen ojos...
Swedish: Krax! Alla ögon på denne. Stora ögon, små ögon. Ögon från ovan och under. Även träden har ögon…
Thai: กา กา! ทุกสายตาจดจ้องอยู่เจ้า ตาใหญ่ ตาเล็ก ตาจากเบื้องบน ตาจากเบื้องล่าง แม้แต่ต้นไม้ก็มีตา…
Turkish: Gaak! Tüm gözler bunun üzerinde. Büyük gözler, küçük gözler, yukarıdakiler, aşağıdakiler. Ağaçların bile gözleri vardır…
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Усі очі стежать. Великі очища й маленькі щілинки, і ті, що згори, і ті, що внизу. Навіть у дерев є очі…

English: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Abenaki: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Bulgarian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Chinese: 勇士，你竟然还活着？我本来还想等你死后饱餐一顿呢，打个牙祭你懂的...好吧，诸神之父会满意的。
Croatian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Czech: Stále žiješ, válečníku? Doufal jsem v malé občerstvení z tvé mrtvoly, sousto mršiny... Přesto bude Otec Veškerenstva potěšen.
Danish: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Dutch: Je leeft nog, krijger? Ik had gehoopt een hapje van je resten te mogen nemen, een stukje van je kadaver... Ach, de Alvader zal in ieder geval verheugd zijn.
Estonian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Finnish: Olet vielä hengissä, soturi? Toivoin että olisin voinut napsia herkkupaloja ruumiistasi, raadon muruja… Kaikesta huolimatta, Kaikkivaltias tulee olemaan tyytyväinen.
French: Vous êtes encore en vie, guerrier ? J'espérais grignoter vos restes, faire un festin de votre charogne... Ah, le Père de Toute Chose sera satisfait.
Georgian: ისევ ცოცხალი ხარ მეომარო? იმედი მქონდა წავიხემსებდი შენი ნარჩენებით... მაინც კმაყოფილი იქნებოდა ოდინი.
German: Du bist immer noch am Leben, Krieger? Ich hatte schon gehofft, ich könnte mich an deinem Leichnam laben … Wie auch immer, jedenfalls wird sich der Allvater freuen.
Greek: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Hindi: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Hungarian: Még életben vagy, harcos? Abban reménykedtem, hogy falatozhatok egy kicsit a holttestedből, egy falatnyi döghúst... Mindazonáltal a Mindenatya örülni fog ennek.
Icelandic: Þú lifir en, stríðsmaður? Ég var að vonast til að snarla á leifum þínum, smá biti af hræ... En, þú munt hafa áunnið þér heilli Alföðurs.
Italian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Japanese: 戦士よ、まだ生きているのか？おまえの死体から少々の軽食をいただけるかと期待していたのだが。 一口の腐肉をな... いずれにしても、最高神は喜ぶであろう。
Korean: 아직 살아 있었네, 전사님? 안타까운걸, 시체에서 자그마한 간식을 빼 먹고 싶었는데. 그래도 오딘께서 기뻐하시겠구나.
Lithuanian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Macedonian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Norwegian: Du lever fremdeles, kriger? Jeg hadde håpet på noe fra ditt lik, en bit av kadaveret... Allfaderen vil nok være fornøyd.
Polish: Nadal żyjesz, wojowniku? Liczyłem na małą przekąskę z twojego ciała, kawałeczek padliny… Mimo to Wszechojciec będzie zadowolony.
Portuguese: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Continua vivo, guerreiro? Eu esperava fazer um lanchinho do seu cadáver, talvez um pedaço de carniça… Enfim, o Pai de Todos ficará satisfeito.
Romanian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Russian: Смерть еще не добралась до тебя? А я-то надеялся полакомиться твоим трупом… Тем не менее, Всеотец будет доволен.
Serbian: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Slovak: Still you live, warrior? I had hoped for some little snack from your corpse, some morsel of carrion… Still, the Allfather will be pleased.
Spanish: ¿Sigues con vida? Yo que quería darme un pequeño festín de carroña con tu cadáver... En fin, el Padre Todopoderoso estará contento.
Swedish: Du lever än, krigare? Jag hade hoppats på en liten munsbit från ditt lik, en måltid kadaver... Nå, Allfadern kommer bli nöjd.
Thai: ยังมีชีวิตอยู่อีกเหรอเจ้านักรบ? หวังว่าข้าจะได้ฉีกกินซากที่ไร้วิญญาณของเจ้า… บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งคงจะมีความสุขกับเรื่องนี้
Turkish: Hâlâ hayatta mısın savaşçı? Cesedinden, çürümüş etinden, ufak bir lokma alır, atıştırmalık yaparım diyordum… Yine de hayatta olman, Tanrıbaba'nın hoşuna gidecek.
Ukrainian: Усе ще серед живих, га? Сподівався перекусити трохи — усього декілька ласих шматочків із твого мертвого тіла… Що ж, Всебатько буде задоволений.

English: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Abenaki: K'wanôbam pzgawak, kia migakawinnoid? N'namitogaki kagui wawaldaman salakiwi, ôwdik pamkannian, ta nigikeda gzaldmôan. Kdmôgi migakawinno…
Bulgarian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Chinese: 勇士，你在迷雾中迷路了吗？我可以看到你眼里的景象，你走过的路，你爱过的人。 太可怜了...
Croatian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Czech: Ztratil jsi se v mlze, válečníku? Vidím věci, které tvé oči kdysi viděly, cesty, po kterých jsi šlapal, a tváře, které jsi miloval. Chudák válečník…
Danish: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Dutch: Ben je verdwaald in de mist, krijger? Ik zie wat je ogen ooit wisten, de paden die je hebt bewandeld, en de gezichten die je ooit liefhad. Arme krijger...
Estonian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Finnish: Oletko eksyksissä sumussa, soturi? Näen asiat jotka silmäsi joskus tunsi, polut joita kuljit, ja kasvot joita rakastit. Soturi parka…
French: Vous vous égarez dans le brouillard, guerrier ? Je vois des choses que vos yeux ont connues, des chemins que vous avez parcourus et des visages que vous avez aimés. Pauvre guerrier...
Georgian: ნისლში დაიკარგე მეომარო? ვხედავ იმას, რასაც ოდესღაც შენი თვალები ხედავნდნენ, გზები რომლითაც დადიოდი, სახეები, რომლებიც გიყვარდა. ეჰ, საწყალო...
German: Hast du dich im Nebel verlaufen, Krieger? Ich sehe Dinge, die deine Augen einst kannten. Wege, die du beschritten und Gesichter, die du geliebt hast. Du arme Kriegerseele …
Greek: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Hindi: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Hungarian: Eltévedtél a ködben, harcos? Olyan dolgokat látok, amelyeket a szemeid egykor ismertek; járt ösvényeket és szeretett arcokat. Szegény harcos...
Icelandic: Ertu týndur í þokuni, stríðsmaður? Ég sé það sem þú eitt sinn þekktir, leiðir þú gekkst, andlit þú elskaðir. Vesalings stríðsmaður...
Italian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Japanese: 戦士よ、霧に迷ったか？見えるぞ。 おまえの目がかつて知っていたもの、おまえが歩いた道、愛した顔が。 哀れな戦士よ...
Korean: 전사님 안갯속에서 길을 잃었구나? 나에게는 네 안구에 맺혔던 것들이 보여. 네가 살아왔던 길, 네가 사랑했던 얼굴들. 불쌍한 우리 전사님...
Lithuanian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Macedonian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Norwegian: Er du tapt i tåken, kriger? Jeg ser ting dine øyne før visste om, veier du gikk og ansikter du elsket. Stakkars kriger...
Polish: Nie potrafisz znaleźć drogi we mgle, wojowniku? Widzę rzeczy, które kiedyś ujrzały twe oczy, przebyte ścieżki i ukochane twarze. Biedny wojowniku…
Portuguese: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Portuguese_Brazilian: Você se perdeu na névoa, guerreiro? Eu vejo coisas que seus olhos conheceram, caminhos que você trilhou e rostos que você amou. Pobre guerreiro…
Romanian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Russian: Ты потерялся в тумане, воин? Я вижу то, что когда-то видели твои глаза, пути, которыми ты шел, и лица, которые ты любил. Бедняга...
Serbian: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Slovak: Are you lost in the fog, warrior? I see things your eyes once knew, paths you trod and faces you loved. Poor warrior…
Spanish: ¿Te has perdido entre la niebla? Veo cosas que tus ojos conocían muy bien, los caminos que has recorrido e incluso las caras de tus seres queridos. Qué lástima das...
Swedish: Är du vilse i dimman, krigare? Jag ser saker dina ögon en gång sett; stigar du farit och ansikten du älskat. Stackars krigare…
Thai: เจ้ากำลังสับสนอยู่หรือไง? ข้ามองเห็นสิ่งต่าง ๆ ที่ก่อตัวขึ้นในดวงตาของเจ้า เส้นทางที่เจ้าเคยเหยียบย่ำ ใบหน้าของคนที่เจ้ารัก เจ้านักรบผู้น่าสงสาร...
Turkish: Sisin içinde kayıp mı oldun savaşçı? Bir zamanlar bildiğin şeyleri, yürüdüğün yolları ve sevdiğin yüzleri görüyorum. Zavallı savaşçı…
Ukrainian: Що, блукаєш у тумані, га? Я бачу речі, які колись знали твої очі, шляхи, якими ходили твої ноги, й обличчя, які любило твоє серце. От бідолашний…

English: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Abenaki: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Bulgarian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Chinese: Kraa！别忘了你的任务，流浪者！记得你为什么被诸神之父送来这里。 被遗忘者必须被摧毁。 切记！
Croatian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Czech: Kraa! Nezapomeňte na svůj úkol, poutníku! Pamatuj si, proč tě sem poslal Otec Veškerenstva. Ztracení musí být zničeni. Pamatuj si!
Danish: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Dutch: Kraa! Vergeet je queeste niet, krijger! Vergeet niet waarom de Alvader je hierheen gestuurd heeft. De Verlatenen moeten worden vernietigd. Vergeet dat niet!
Estonian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Finnish: Kraa! Ällös unohda tehtävääsi, kulkija! Muista miksi Isä lähetti sinut tänne. Hyljätyt täytyy tuhota. Muista!
French: Croââ ! N'oubliez pas votre quête, aventurier ! N'oubliez pas pourquoi le Père de Toute Chose vous veut sur ce monde. Les Déchus doivent être détruits. Ne l'oubliez pas !
Georgian: კრაა! შენი დავალება გახსოვდეს უცნობო! გახსოვდეს თუ რატომ გამოგგზავნა ოდინმა. დაცემულები უნდა გაანადგურო. არ დაგავიწყდეს!
German: Krah! Vergiss nicht deine Aufgabe, Wanderer! Vergiss nicht, warum Odin dich hierher gesandt hat. Die Wächter müssen vernichtet werden. Vergiss das nicht!
Greek: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Hindi: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Hungarian: Káár! Ne feledkezz meg a küldetésedről, vándor! Emlékezz arra, miért küldött ide a Mindenatya! A cserbenhagyottakat el kell pusztítani, ne feledd!
Icelandic: Krúnk! Ekki gleyma að þú átt verkefni óklárað, ferðalangi! Mundu afhverju Alfaðir senti þig hingað. Hinir yfirgefnu þurfa að deyja. Mundu það!
Italian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Japanese: クワァァ！使命を忘れるな、さすらい人！最高神になぜここに送られたか思い出せ。 見捨てられしものは倒されねばならぬ。 覚えておけ！
Korean: 까악! 사명을 잊지 마, 방랑자! 최고신께서 어째서 너를 이곳에 보내셨는지 기억해. 버림받은 자들은 쓰러져야만 한다고. 기억해!
Lithuanian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Macedonian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Norwegian: Kraa! Ikke glem oppdraget ditt, vandrer! Husk hvorfor Allfaderen sendte deg hit. De Fortapte må ødelegges. Husk!
Polish: Kraa! Nie zapomnij o swojej misji, wędrowcze! Pamiętaj, dlaczego Wszechojciec cię tu przysłał. Wygnani muszą zostać zgładzeni. Nie zapomnij o tym!
Portuguese: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Não se esqueça de sua missão, viajante! Lembre-se do porque que o Pai de Todos enviou você para cá. Os Guardiões devem ser destruídos. Lembre-se!
Romanian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Russian: Крра! Помни о своем задании, странник! Помни, почему Всеотец послал тебя сюда. Павшие должны быть уничтожены. Не забудь!
Serbian: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Slovak: Kraa! Do not forget your quest, wanderer! Remember why the Allfather sent you here. The Forsaken Ones must be destroyed. Remember!
Spanish: ¡Crouh! ¡No te olvides de tu misión, caminante! Recuerda por qué te envió el Todo Poderoso. Debes destruir a los Desterrados. ¡No lo olvides!
Swedish: Krax! Glöm inte ditt uppdrag, vandrare! Minns varför Allfadern sänt dig hit. De Bannlysta måste förgöras! Minns!
Thai: กา กา! อย่าลืมภารกิจสิเจ้าคนหลงทาง! คิดให้ดีว่าทำไมบิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งถึงส่งเจ้ามาที่นี่ พวกผู้ถูกเนรเทศต้องถูกทำลาย จำเอาไว้ให้ดี!
Turkish: Gaak! Görevini unutma yolgezer! Tanrıbaba'nın seni buraya neden gönderdiğini hatırla. Yitikler yok edilmeli. Unutma!
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Не забувай свого завдання, людино! Пам’ятай, для чого Всебатько направив тебе сюди. Забутих треба знищити. Не забувай!

English: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Abenaki: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Bulgarian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Chinese:
哇，你成长成一名强壮了战士了！不过其实出于礼貌，我应该在你死的时候才告诉你这个的，我和福金都商量好了，他吃你的左眼，我吃你的右眼。 
嗯，祝安好！
Croatian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Czech: Ah, vyrostl z tebe skvělý válečník! Jako laskavost bych ti měl říct, že až zemřeš, dohodli jsme se, že Hugin bude mít tvoje levé oko jako dárek a já budu mít pravé. Ale přejeme ti ať se ti daří dobře!
Danish: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Dutch: Je bent een goede krijger geworden! Uit goed fatsoen moet ik je vertellen dat als je doodgaat, we het erover eens zijn dat Hugin je linkeroog mag hebben als tussendoortje, en ik je rechter. Maar we wensen je verder alle goeds!
Estonian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Finnish: Ah, sinusta on tullut väkevä soturi! Ehkä minun pitäisi kohteliaisuudesta paljastaa, että sovimme Huginin kanssa jakavamme silmäsi kuollessasi. Ne ovat herkkua. Mutta joka tapauksessa: toivotamme sinulle onnea!
French: Ah, vous êtes digne qu'on vous appelle guerrier, à présent ! Je devrais vous informer, par politesse, que si vous mourez, Hugin mangera votre œil gauche et moi, le droit. Mais nous vous souhaitons bonne chance !
Georgian: აჰ, როგორი კარგი მეომარი დამდგარხარ! სიხარულით გეტყვი ცემი და ჰუგინის შეთანხმებას. როცა მოკვდები ის შენ მარცხენა თვალს მიირთმევს, მე კი - მარჯვენას. მაგრამ ჩვენ მაინც წარმატებებს გისუვებთ!
German: Du hast dich zu einem mächtigen Kämpfer entwickelt! Aus reiner Höflichkeit sollst du wissen - wenn du stirbst, wird Hugin dein linkes Auge fressen und ich dein rechtes. Aber wir wünschen dir dennoch alles Gute.
Greek: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Hindi: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Hungarian: Áh, remek harcossá váltál. Figyelmességből el kell árulnom neked, megegyeztem Huginnal, hogy amikor meghalsz, a bal szemedet ő kapja csemegének, míg a jobbat én. Viszont mind ketten jó egészséget kívánunk neked.
Icelandic: Þú hefur vaxið í myndarlegan stríðsmann! Sem kurteisi, þá ætti ég að tilkynna þér að þegar þú deyrð, mun Huginn fá vinstra augað þitt að borða og ég það hægra. En, við óskum þér góðs gengis!
Italian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Japanese: おお、良い戦士になったものだ！礼儀として伝えておこう。 おまえが死んだ時のフギンとの取り決めだ。 フギンはおまえの左目を、我はおまえの右目をいただくことになっている。 だが無事を祈っているぞ！
Korean: 아, 넌 훌륭한 전사가 되었구나! 이건 예의상 말하는 건데, 우리는 네가 죽으면 후긴이 너의 왼쪽 눈을 간식으로 가져가고, 나는 오른쪽 눈을 가지기로 동의했어. 하지만 우리는 항상 널 응원하고 있어!
Lithuanian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Macedonian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Norwegian: Ah, du har vokst til en god kriger! Som en høflighet skal jeg fortelle deg at når du dør har vi blitt enige om at Hugin får ditt venstre øye som en godbit og at jeg får det høyre. Men vi ønsker deg vel!
Polish: Ach, ale z ciebie wspaniały wojownik! Z grzeczności powiem ci, że kiedy umrzesz, ustaliliśmy, że Hugin dostanie do schrupania twoje lewe oko, a ja prawe. Ale życzymy powodzenia!
Portuguese: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Ah, que grande guerreiro você se tornou! Como cortesia, devo dizer que, quando você morrer, concordamos que Hugin terá seu olho esquerdo e eu, o direito. Mas desejamos tudo de bom!
Romanian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Russian: Ах, какой славный воин из тебя вышел! С радостью расскажу тебе о нашем с Хугином договоре. После твоей смерти он получит твой левый глаз в качестве угощения, а я — правый. Но мы желаем тебе удачи!
Serbian: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Slovak: Ah, you have grown into a fine warrior! As a courtesy, I should tell you that when you die, we have agreed that Hugin will have your left eye as a treat and I will have your right. But we wish you well!
Spanish: Te has vuelto muy fuerte, sí señor. Como muestra de cortesía, te haré saber que Hugin y yo hemos acordado que, cuando mueras, yo me quedaré tu ojo derecho y él el izquierdo. ¡Pero te deseamos lo mejor!
Swedish:
Ah, du har vuxit dig till en mäktig krigare. Som en artighet kan jag förtälja att vi bestämt att Hugin ska få ditt vänstra öga när du dör, och jag ditt högra.
Men vi önskar dig all lycka till!
Thai: เจ้าเติบโตเป็นนักรบที่แข็งแกร่งแล้ว! ตามมารยาทข้าควรบอกเรื่องนี้กับเจ้า เมื่อเจ้าตายเราได้ตกลงกันไว้ว่าฮูกิ้นจะได้กินดวงตาข้างซ้ายของเจ้า และข้าจะกินดวงตาข้างขวา ยังไงก็ขอให้เจ้าปลอดภัย!
Turkish: Hah, yağız bir savaşçı olmuşsun! Nezakettendir, aklında bulunsun. Öldüğünde Hugin sol, ben de sağ gözünü alacağım. Yine de, elbette, bol şans dileriz!
Ukrainian: Ого! Оце твоя бойова майстерність виросла! Із ввічливості скажу, що ми домовилися з Хуґіном, що після твоєї смерті він видовбе твоє ліве око, а я — праве. Але ми обидва бажаємо тобі всього найкращого!

English: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Abenaki: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Bulgarian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Chinese: Kraa！奥丁对你很满意，让我来恢复你的记忆。 你还记得你的前世吗？其实你的前世还记得你...
Croatian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Czech: Kraa! Služ dobře otcovi všeho a já ti budu moct obnovit tvé vzpomínky. Pamatuješ si na život, který jsi měli před tímto? Stále si tě pamatuje...
Danish: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Dutch: Kraa! Dien de Alvader goed, dan mag ik van hem je herinneringen teruggeven. Weet je nog wat voor leven je had voor je hier kwam? Het herinnert zich jou wel…
Estonian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Finnish: Kraa! Palvele Isän tahtoa, niin hän antaa minulle luvan palauttaa muistosi. Muistatko elämän, joka sinulla oli ennen tätä? Se muistaa yhä sinut...
French: Croââ ! Servez le Père de Toute Chose comme il le faut et votre mémoire vous sera rendue. Vous rappelez-vous votre vie avant celle-ci ? Et pourtant, elle se souvient de vous...
Georgian: კრაა! ემსახურე ოდინს კარგად და ის უფლებას მომცემს რომ მეხსირება დაგიბრუნო. გახსოვს კი ის სამყარო სადაც აქამდე ცხოვრობდი? მას კი ახსოვხარ...
German: Krah! Diene dem Allvater, so gut du kannst, und er wird mir erlauben, deine Erinnerungen wiederherzustellen. Erinnerst du dich an das Leben, das du vor diesem hier hattest? Zumindest erinnert es sich an dich...
Greek: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Hindi: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Hungarian: Káár! Ha jól szolgálod a Mindenatyát, lehetővé tette számomra, hogy helyreállítsam az emlékeidet. Emlékszel az életedre a mostani előttről? Az még emlékszik rád...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Þjónaðu Alföður vel og hann leyfir mér að endurvekja minningar þínar úr fyrra lífi. Mannstu eitthvað úr því? Það man eftir þér...
Italian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Japanese: クワァァ！最高神によく仕えれば、おまえの記憶を取り戻してよいという許可を授かっておる。 今の前に送っていた人生を覚えているか？人生はおまえを覚えているぞ...
Korean: 까악! 최고신께 네 기억을 되돌려도 좋다는 허락을 받았어, 그러니 최고신을 잘 섬기라고. 이 이전의 삶을 기억해? 그 삶은 아직 널 기억하고 있어...
Lithuanian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Macedonian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Norwegian: Kraa! Adlyd Allfaderen godt og han har gitt meg lov til å gi tilbake noen av minnene dine. Husker du livet ditt før dette? Det husker fremdeles deg...
Polish: Kraa! Służ dobrze Wszechojcu, a on pozwoli mi przywrócić twoje wspomnienia. Czy pamiętasz swoje ówczesne życie? Ono jeszcze cię pamięta...
Portuguese: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Sirva bem ao Pai de Todos e ele me dará permissão para restaurar suas memórias. Você se lembra da vida que teve antes desta? Ela ainda lembra de você...
Romanian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Russian: Крра! Служи Всеотцу хорошо, и он позволит мне восстановить твои воспоминания. Помнишь ли ты мир, в котором жил до этого? А он тебя помнит...
Serbian: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Slovak: Kraa! Serve the Allfather well and he has given me leave to restore your memories. Do you remember the life you had before this one? It yet remembers you...
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Sirve bien al Padre Todopoderoso, pues me ha dado permiso para recuperarte la memoria. ¿Recuerdas la vida que tuviste antes de esta? Porque ella sí que te recuerda a ti...
Swedish: Krax! Tjäna Allfadern väl, så kan jag ge dig dina minnen åter. Minns du livet du hade innan detta? Det minns dig, ännu...
Thai: กา กา! จงรับใช้บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งให้ดี แล้วเขาจะให้ข้าฟื้นความทรงจำของเจ้า จำชีวิตก่อนหน้านี้ของเจ้าได้ไหม? มันยังจดจำเจ้าได้...
Turkish: Gaak! Tanrıbaba'ya iyi hizmet edersen anılarını sana geri verebileceğimi söyledi. Bundan önceki hayatını hatırlıyor musun? O seni hatırlıyor...
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Служи Всебатькові добре, і він дозволить мені відновити твої спогади. Ти пам’ятаєш своє попереднє життя? А воно все ще пам’ятає тебе…

English: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Abenaki: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Bulgarian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Chinese: 我没想到你竟然可以活这么久....不过别太骄傲，朋友。 战场对我来说就是宴席，我知道所有勇猛战士的结局..
Croatian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Czech: Nemyslel jsem si, že tak dlouho přežiješ... Ale chraň se proti pýše, příteli. Bojiště jsou pro mě bankety, vím, jak končí všichni velcí válečníci...
Danish: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Dutch: Ik had niet gedacht dat je nog in leven zou zijn… Maar hoed je voor trots, vriend. Slagvelden zijn mijn banket, en ik weet hoe alle grote krijgers aan hun eind komen…
Estonian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Finnish: En ajatellut sinun selviävän näin pitkään... Mutta varo ylpeyttä, toveri. Taistelukentät ovat minulle kuin pitopöytä; tiedän miten kaikille väkeville sotureille käy lopuksi...
French: Je ne pensais pas que vous survivriez aussi longtemps... Mais ne paradez pas. Les champs de bataille sont mes festins, je sais comment finissent tous les grands guerriers...
Georgian: არც კი მეგონა თუ ამდენი ხანი გადარჩებოდი... მაგრამ სიამაყე არ მოგერიოს მეგობარო. ბრძოლის ველები საქეიფო დახლივითაა ჩემთვის, და ვიცი როგორ ამთავრებენ დიადი მეომრები...
German: Ich hätte nicht gedacht, dass du so lange überleben würdest… Aber hüte dich vor deinem eigenen Stolz. Für mich sind Schlachtfelder nichts anderes als große Bankette: Ich weiß also, wie alle großen Krieger enden...
Greek: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Hindi: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Hungarian: Nem gondoltam volna, hogy ilyen sokáig életben maradsz... Viszont óvakodj a büszkeségtől, barátom! A csatamezők számomra ünnepségek, és tudom, az összes nagy harcos hogyan végzi...
Icelandic: Ég hafði ekki hugsað mér að þú myndir lifa svona lengi... En verum ekki of stoltir, vinur. Stríðsvellir eru veisluhöld fyrir mér, ég veit hvernig öll líf góðra bardagamanna enda...
Italian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Japanese: おまえがこれほど長く生きるとは思っていなかった... だが驕るな、友よ。 戦場は我には宴会の場。 偉大なる戦士がどのように斃れたかよく知っているぞ...
Korean: 네가 이리 오래 살아남을 줄은 몰랐어. 하지만 오만해지지 않도록 주의해 친구야. 나는 전장을 연회장 드나들듯 다녀서 위대한 전사들의 끝이 어땠는지 잘 알고 있어.
Lithuanian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Macedonian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Norwegian: Jeg trodde ikke du ville overleve så lenge... Men pass deg for stoltheten, min venn. Slagmarken er som et festmåltid for meg, jeg vet hvordan alle mektige krigere ender...
Polish: Nie sądziłem, że przeżyjesz tak długo… Ale strzeż się dumy, przyjacielu. Pola bitew są dla mnie ucztą. Wiem, jak kończą wszyscy śmiałkowie...
Portuguese: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Não pensei que você pudesse sobreviver por tanto tempo… Mas não se deixe tomar pelo orgulho, amigo. Os campos de batalha são banquetes para mim, eu sei como todos os grandes guerreiros terminam…
Romanian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Russian: Я не думал, что ты так долго проживешь... Но берегись гордыни, дружище. Поля сражений для меня — пир. Я знаю, как заканчивают все великие воины...
Serbian: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Slovak: I had not thought you would survive so long… But guard against pride, friend. Battlefields are banquets to me, I know how all great warriors end...
Spanish: Jamás creí que fueras a sobrevivir tanto tiempo, pero no dejes que te consuma el orgullo. Los campos de batalla son mis banquetes personales, y sé de sobra cómo acaban los guerreros más poderosos...
Swedish: Jag trodde aldrig du skulle överleva så här länge… Men var på din vakt mot stoltheten, min vän. Slagfält är banketter för mig, och jag vet hur stora krigare tenderar sluta…
Thai: ข้าไม่คิดว่าเจ้าจะรอดชีวิตได้นานขนาดนี้… แต่อย่าอวดดีให้มากนักล่ะ สนามรบมันก็เป็นเหมือนงานเลี้ยงสำหรับข้า ข้ารู้ดีว่านักรบผู้ยิ่งใหญ่ทั้งหลายนั้นมีจุดจบแบบไหน...
Turkish: Bu kadar uzun süre hayatta kalabileceğini düşünmezdim… Lakin kibirden sakın dostum. Savaş meydanları benim şölen soframdır ve her büyük savaşçının sonunu bilirim...
Ukrainian: І гадки не мав, що ти протягнеш так довго… Але не задирай носа, людино. Поля битви — мій обідній стіл. Я знаю, який кінець стрічають великі воїни й воїтельки…

English: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Abenaki: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Bulgarian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Chinese: Kraa！听着！我不会再给你指引了。 我是伟大的雾尼，记忆宝库。 我站在诸神之父的左肩上为他在第十大神界压标。 我曾经看到了各个战士的起起落落，但是是最伟大的战士之一。 记住，奥丁一直在看着你...
Croatian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Czech: Kraa! Slyš mě, už nebudu mluvit v hádankách. Jsem velký Munin, pokladník paměti. Sedím na levém rameni otce všeho a vykonávám jeho rozkazy v desátém světě. Viděl jsem mnoho velkých válečníků povstávat a padat, ale ty patříš mezi největší. Věř, že tě sám Odin sleduje...
Danish: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Dutch: Kraa! Hoor mij, want ik zal je niet langer van raadsels voorzien. Ik ben de grote Munin, de schatkamer der herinneringen. Ik zit op de linkerschouder van de Alvader, en doe in de tien werelden wat hij me opdraagt. Ik heb veel grote krijgers zien vallen en opstaan, maar jij bent een van de grootsten. Weet dat Odin zelve je in het oog houdt…
Estonian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Finnish: Kraa! Kuule minua, en vaivaa päätäsi enää pidempään. Olen mahtava Munin, muistin aarreaitta. Istun Isän vasemmalla olkapäällä ja kierrän kymmenessä maailmassa toteuttamassa hänen tahtoaan. Olen nähnyt monien mahtavien soturien nousun ja tuhon, mutta sinä olet väkevimpien joukossa. Tiedä, että itse Odin tarkkailee liikkeitäsi...
French: Croââ ! Écoutez-moi bien, j'irai désormais droit au but. Je suis le grand Munin, le réceptacle des souvenirs. Je me perche sur l'épaule gauche du Père de Toute Chose et j'accomplis sa volonté dans les dix mondes. J'ai vu nombre de guerriers s'élever et tomber, mais vous faites partie des plus grands. Sachez qu'Odin lui-même vous regarde...
Georgian: კრაა! მისმინე, მე მეტჯერ აღარ ამოვხსნი შენს გამოცანებს შენ მაგივრად. მე დიადი მუნინი ვარ, მეხსიერების საგანძურის მფლობელი. მე ოდინის მარცხენა მხარზე ვზივარდ და მის ბრძანებებს 10 სამყაროში გადავცემ. მე უამრავი დიადი მებრძოლი შემხვედრია, რომელიბ დგებოდნენ და ეცემოდნენ, მაგრამ ერთ-ერთი ხარ უდიდესთა შორის. იცოდე რომ, თვითონ ოდინი გადევნებს თვალს...
German: Krah! Hör mich an, mich den großen Munin, mich, eine Enzyklopädie des Wissens, mich, der ich auf der linken Schulter des Allvaters sitze und ihm in den zehn Welten zu Diensten bin: Ich habe schon so manchen großen Krieger aufsteigen und fallen gesehen. Doch du zählst zu den größten von ihnen. Wisse, dass Odin selbst ein Auge auf dich hat...
Greek: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Hindi: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Hungarian: Káár! Hallgass most meg, többé nem titkolózom előtted. A hatalmas Munin vagyok, az emlékek kincstára. A Mindenatya bal vállán ülök, és tíz világban teljesítem a parancsait. Sok harcos láttam felemelkedni, és elbukni, de te a legnagyobbak között vagy. Tudd, hogy maga Odin figyelemmel követ téged...
Icelandic: Krúnk! Nú skal hlusta á mig. Ég mun ekki lesa þér ljóð ei lengur. Ég er hinn mikli Muninn, safnari minninga. Ég sit á vinstri öxl Alföðurs og hlíði skipunum hans í öllum tíu heimum. Ég hef séð ótal marga stríðsmenn rísa og falla, en þú ert á meðal þeirra bestu. Vita skal að Óðinn sjálfur fylgist með þér...
Italian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Japanese: クワァァ！とくと聞け。 もはや謎かけはせぬ。 我は偉大なるムニン、記憶の宝庫である。 我は最高神の左の肩に止まり、十の世界で彼の命を成し遂げる。 多くの偉大なる戦士の栄光と没落を見てきたが、おまえは最高の戦士のひとりだ。 オーディンそのひとが見ていると知れ...
Korean: 까악! 내 말을 들어라. 더 이상 수수께끼는 하지 않는다. 나는 위대한 무닌, 기억의 보고다. 나는 최고 신의 왼쪽 어깨에 머물며, 10개의 세계에서 그분의 명령을 실행하지. 많은 위대한 전사들의 영광과 몰락을 봤지만, 너는 최고의 전사 중 한 명이야. 오딘께서 널 지켜보고 계시다는 걸 알아둬...
Lithuanian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Macedonian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Norwegian: Kraa! Hør meg nå, jeg skal ikke gi deg gåter lenger. Jeg er den store Munin, minnenes skattehus. Jeg sitter på Allfaderens venstre skulder for å følge hans ordre i alle de ti verdener. Jeg har sett mange mektige krigere leve og dø, men du er blandt de mektigste. Vit at Odin selv ser deg...
Polish: Kraa! Wysłuchaj mnie teraz, a już nie będę cię zagadywać. Jestem wielki Munin, skarbnica pamięci. Siedzę na lewym ramieniu Wszechojca i wykonuję jego rozkazy w Dziesięciu światach. Widziałem, jak wielu wielkich wojowników powstaje i upada, ale ty jesteś jednym z największych. Wiedz, że sam Odyn cię obserwuje...
Portuguese: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! Ouça-me agora, não serei mais enigmático. Eu sou o grande Munin, o tesouro da memória. Eu sento no ombro esquerdo do Pai de Todos e sigo suas ordens nos dez mundos. Já vi muitos guerreiros grandiosos ascenderem e caírem, mas você está entre os maiores. Saiba que o próprio Odin está o observando…
Romanian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Russian: Крра! Услышь меня, я больше не буду загадывать тебе загадки. Я — великий Мунин, хранитель памяти. Я сижу на левом плече Всеотца и передаю его приказы в десяти мирах. Я видел много великих воинов, которые поднимались и падали, но ты один из величайших. Знай, что сам Один наблюдает за тобой...
Serbian: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Slovak: Kraa! Hear me now, I'll riddle you no longer. I am great Munin, the treasure-house of memory. I sit on the left shoulder of the Allfather and do his bidding in the ten worlds. I have seen many great warriors rise and fall but you are among the greatest. Know that Odin himself is watching you...
Spanish: ¡Crouh! Escúchame bien, ¡no me andaré con más enigmas! Soy el gran Munin, la tesorería de los recuerdos. Reposo sobre el hombro del Padre Todopoderoso y hago su voluntad en los diez mundos. He visto nacer y caer a grandes guerreros, pero tú brillas con más fuerza que la mayoría. El mismísimo Odín vela por ti...
Swedish: Krax! Lyss till mig nu, när mina gåtor upphör. Jag är Munin, minnenas väktare och skattkammare. På Allfaderns vänstra axel sitter jag, och agerar bud i Världarna Tio. Jag har sett stora krigare resa sig och falla, men du är en av de största. Vet väl att Oden själv vakar över dig...
Thai: กา กา! จงฟังข้า ข้าจะไม่พูดมากนัก ข้าคือมูนินผู้ยิ่งใหญ่ ผู้เป็นดุจดั่งขุมทรัพย์แห่งความทรงจำ ข้าเกาะอยู่บนไหล่ซ้ายของบิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่ง และรายงานความเคลื่อนไหวในโลกที่สิบให้เขารับรู้ ข้าเคยเห็นนักรบมากมายที่รุ่งโรจน์ และล้มเหลว แต่เจ้าเป็นหนึ่งในนักรบที่ดีที่สุด จำเอาไว้ว่าโอดินกำลังเฝ้ามองเจ้าอยู่...
Turkish: Gak! Bana kulak ver, artık bilmece yok. Ben, anıların koruyucusu, yüce Munin'im. Tanrıbaba'nın sol omzunda oturur, on dünyadaki işlerini görürüm. Pek çok büyük savaşçının yükseliş ve düşüşüne tanıklık ettim ama sen en kudretlilerindensin. Bil ki, bizzat Odin seni izliyor...
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Слухай мене, загадок більше не буде. Я величний Мунін, скарбниця пам’яті. Я сиджу на правому плечі Всебатька й виконую його доручення в десяти світах. Я бачив злети й падіння воїнів, але ти — серед найкращих. Знай, що сам Одін спостерігає за тобою…

English: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Abenaki: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Bulgarian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Chinese: Kraa！诸神之父发出了他的旨意! He waits on your word to send the great bridge.击杀被遗忘者们，并清理你的前路！
Croatian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Czech: Kraa! Otec Veškerenstva posílá zprávy! Čeká na tvé slovo, aby poslal velký most. Zabij ztracené a otevři cestu!
Danish: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Dutch: Kraa! Ik breng nieuws van de Alvader! Hij staat klaar om op jouw verzoek de grote brug te openen. Dood de Verlatenen en maak de weg vrij!
Estonian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Finnish: Kraa! Isä lähettää terveisensä. Hänen odottaa sanaasi lähettääkseen suuren sillan. Tapa Hyljätyt ja raivaa tie!
French: Croââ ! Le Père de Toute Chose vous salue ! Il n'attend qu'un signe pour envoyer le grand pont. Tuez les Déchus et dégagez la voie !
Georgian: კრაა! შეისმინე მამა ღმერთის! ის გელოდება, რომ დაუშვას დიდი ხიდი. მოკალი დაცემულები და გაწმინდე გზა!
German: Krah! Der Allvater hat wichtige Neuigkeiten für dich! Er wartet darauf, für dich die große Brücke zu öffnen. Also brich auf, töte Wächter und mache den Weg frei!
Greek: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Hindi: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Hungarian: Káár! A Mindenatya híreket küld! A szavadra vár, hogy elküldhesse a nagy hidat. Öld meg a cserbenhagyottakat és tisztítsd meg az utat!
Icelandic: Krúnk! Alfaðir sendir tíðindi! Hann bíður eftir þér og sendir brúna miklu á þínu orði. Dreptu hina yfirgefnu og hreinsaðu vegin!
Italian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Japanese: クワァァ！最高神よりの言葉だ！大いなる橋に送り出さんとする知らせをお待ちである。 見捨てられしものを倒し、道を開け！
Korean: 까악! 최고신께서 말씀하셨어! 그분께서 위대한 다리를 보내기 위해 너의 말을 기다리고 있어. 버림받은 놈들을 쓰러뜨리고 길을 열어라!
Lithuanian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Macedonian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Norwegian: Kraa! Allfaderen sender nyheter. Han venter ditt ord for å sende over den store broen som vil koble sammen verdene igjen. Drep De Fortapte for å gjøre klar veien!
Polish: Kraa! Wszechojciec przesyła wieści! Czeka na twoje słowo, by pojawił się wielki most. Zgładź Wygnanych i oczyść drogę!...
Portuguese: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Portuguese_Brazilian: Crá! O Pai de Todos manda notícias! Ele está apenas esperando você para enviar a grande ponte. Mate os Guardiões e limpe o caminho!
Romanian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Russian: Крра! Услышь Всеотца! Он ждет тебя, чтобы опустить великий мост. Убей павших и расчисть путь!
Serbian: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Slovak: Kraa! The Allfather sends tidings! He waits on your word to send the great bridge. Kill the Forsaken Ones and clear the way!
Spanish: ¡Crouh! ¡Traigo noticias del Padre Todopoderoso! Está a la espera de tu señal para enviar el gran puente. Acaba con los Desterrados y despeja el camino.
Swedish: Krax! Allfadern sänder hälsningar. Han väntar på ditt ord att skicka bron. Dräp de Bannlysta och bana väg!
Thai: กา กา! บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งฝากทักทายเจ้า! เขากำลังรอข่าวดีของเจ้าที่จะถูกส่งไปยังสะพานสายรุ้งอันยิ่งใหญ่ จงสังหารเหล่าผู้ถูกเนรเทศ และเปิดเส้นทาง!
Turkish: Gaak! Tanrıbaba'dan haber var! Ulu köprüyü göndermek için senden haber bekliyor. Yitikler'i öldür ve yolu temizle!
Ukrainian: Кар-р! Всебатько шле звістку! Він чекає твого слова, щоб опустити міст. Убий Забутих та очисть шлях!

Thai: ตำนาน: หมูป่า
ตำนาน: เฟนริ่ง
สูงสุด
เสียงเอฟเฟกต์

English: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Abenaki: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Bulgarian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Chinese: 很久很久以前，在奥丁都还不曾注意到英灵神殿时，曾经在这里也有着大量的居民，但他们已与世长辞。 去地下探索宝藏吧，但你要小心，因为它们很多还不知道自己已经死去，
Croatian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Czech: Pod zemí jsou už dávno zapomenuté sály mužů a žen, starodávné kmeny, které žily ve Valheimu ještě předtím, než Otec Veškerenstva obrátil své oko na toto místo. Ponoř se hluboko do hledání jejich pokladu, ale pozor, někteří z nich ještě nevědí, že jsou mrtví.
Danish: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Dutch: Onder de grond vind je de hallen van mannen en vrouwen die lang geleden gestorven zijn, oeroude stammen die Valheim bevolkten nog voor de Alvader zijn oog op deze wereld liet vallen. Graaf diep om hun schatten te vinden, maar wees voorzichtig; sommigen weten niet dat ze dood zijn.
Estonian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Finnish: Maan alla on saleja, jotka kuuluivat kauan aikaa sitten kadonneille miehille ja naisille – heimoille, jotka asuivat Valheimissä jo ennen kuin kaikkien olentojen isä, Odin, loi katseensa tähän paikkaan. Selvitä tiesi syvälle kammioihin ja löydä heidän aarteensa, mutta varo: jotkut heistä eivät vielä tiedä olevansa kuolleita.
French: Sous la terre se trouvent des palais d'hommes et de femmes morts depuis longtemps, des tribus anciennes qui vivaient à Valheim bien avant que le Père de Toute Chose tourne son œil vers cet endroit. Enfoncez-vous dans ces profondeurs pour trouver leurs trésors, mais prenez garde. Certains ne savent pas encore qu'ils sont morts.
Georgian: მიწის ქვეშ არსებობს ძლიან ადრე წასული ქალები და კაცები უძველესი ცივილიზაციისა, რომლებიც მანამდე ცხოვრობდნენ ვალჰეიმში, სანამ ოდინი მიაპყრობდა მზერას ამ ადგილს. ჩაეშვით ღრმად მიწის ქვეშ, რომ იპოვოთ მათი საგანძური, მაგრამ ასევე ფრთხილად იყავით. ზოგიერთმა მათგანმა ჯერ კიდევ არ იცის რომ მკვდარია.
German: Unter dem Erdboden liegen die Hallen der Männer und Frauen, die längst vergangen sind. Die Hallen uralter Stämme, die in Valheim lebten, bevor sogar der Allvater sein Auge auf diesen Ort richtete. Tauche tief ins Erdreich ein, um ihre Schätze zu heben. Aber hüte dich: Einige von ihnen wissen noch nicht, dass sie bereits tot sind.
Greek: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Hindi: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Hungarian: A föld alatt rég eltűnt férfiak és nők, ősi törzsek termei rejtőznek, akik Valheimen éltek, még mielőtt a Mindenatya szemet vetett volna erre a helyre. Áss mélyre a kincseik felkutatásához, de vigyázz, egyesek közülük még nem tudják, hogy már meghaltak.
Icelandic: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Italian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Japanese: 地面の下には、はるか昔に滅びた男女の広間がある。 最高神がこの地に目を向けるよりも悠久の以前にValheimに住んでいた古代の部族の者たちである。 深く潜ればその宝が見つかるであろう。 しかし油断するな。 その中には、自分が死んだことをまだ知らぬ者がいる。
Korean: 땅 아래에는 최고신께서 이곳 발헤임에 눈을 돌리기 이전부터 살고 있던 고대 부족인 남녀들의 전당이 있습니다. 깊이 파고들면 그들의 보물을 찾을 수 있지만, 조심하십시오. 그들 중 일부는 아직 그들이 죽었다는 것을 모릅니다.
Lithuanian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Macedonian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Norwegian: Under jorden ligger gangene til menn og kvinner lengst drept, eldgamle stammer som bodde i Valheim også før Allfaderen la øyet på verdenen. Let dypt og finn deres skatter, men vær forsiktig. Mange av dem vet ikke der er døde.
Polish: Pod ziemią kryją się komnaty dawno umarłych mężczyzn i kobiet, starożytnych plemion, które żyły w Valheim, jeszcze zanim Wszechojciec skierował swoje spojrzenie na to miejsce. Zejdź głęboko, aby odkryć ich skarby. Musisz jednak uważać – niektórzy jeszcze nie wiedzą, że nie żyją.
Portuguese: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Portuguese_Brazilian: Sob o solo encontram-se os corredores de homens e mulheres há muito tempo desaparecidos, antigas tribos que viveram em Valheim antes mesmo que o Pai de Todos olhasse para este lugar. Vá até as profundezas para encontrar seus tesouros, mas cuidado, alguns deles ainda não sabem que estão mortos.
Romanian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Russian: Под землей находятся чертоги давно ушедших мужчин и женщин из древних племен, которые жили в Вальхейме еще до того, как Всеотец обратил свой взор на это место. Спуститесь глубоко под землю, чтобы отыскать их сокровища, но будьте осторожны. Некоторые из них еще не знают, что они мертвы.
Serbian: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Slovak: Beneath the ground are the halls of men and women long since gone, ancient tribes who lived in Valheim even before the Allfather turned his eye upon this place. Delve deep to find their treasures but beware, some amongst them do not yet know they are dead.
Spanish: Bajo la tierra se encuentran los salones de los hombres y mujeres que desaparecieron hace eones; las tribus ancestrales que vivían en Valheim antes de que el Padre Todopoderoso se fijara en estas tierras. Si te adentras en las profundidades encontrarás sus tesoros, pero has de tener cautela... pues algunos de ellos aún no saben que están muertos.
Swedish: Under marken finns väldiga hallar, resta av kvinnor och män sedan länge borta; uråldriga stammar som bodde i Valheim även innan Allfadern vände blicken hit. Träd ned i djupen för att söka deras skatter, men var på din vakt. Alla vet inte att de är döda.
Thai: ข้างใต้ผืนดินนี้เป็นโถงสุสานของบรรดาชาย และหญิงที่ลาจากโลกใบนี้ไปนานแล้ว พวกเขาคือชนเผ่าโบราณที่อาศัยอยู่ในวัลไฮม์ พวกเขาอยู่มายาวนานตั้งแต่ก่อนที่บิดาแห่งสรรพสิ่งจะรู้จักกับดินแดนแห่งนี้ เสาะหาสมบัติของพวกเขาแต่ต้องระวังตัวให้ดี เพราะบางคนในหมู่พวกเขายังไม่รู้ตัวว่าได้ตายไปแล้ว
Turkish: Bastığın toprağın altında, Tanrıbaba'dan çok önce Valheim'da yaşamış ve tarihe gömülmüş kadim kabilelere mensup erkekler ve kadınlar yatıyor. Hazineler için derinlere inebilirsin ama unutma, onlardan bazıları hala oralarda ve ölümden bihaberler.
Ukrainian: Ще задовго до того, як Всебатько кинув оком своїм на Вальгайм, жили тут племена прадавні. Давно часи їхні минули, і спочивають нині під землею вони у своїх спочивальнях. Спускайтеся туди, скарби їхні знаходьте та стережіться, бо дехто прокинувся від вічного сну й не знає, що мерцем ожилим ходить.

English: Game restart is required when changing language.
Abenaki: Game restart is required when changing language.
Bulgarian: Game restart is required when changing language.
